“We have four ways of forecasting renewable power. We use software of two renewable energy forecasting companies from Spain and Germany. Apart from that, we use forecasting tools of an Indian company.

Above all these, Tangedco officials forecast wind and solar power based on their experience. Our job is to check all the forecasts and go with the one that is closer to real time,” said the official.

The officials in the REMC will have real-time renewable energy generation data for a 15-minute time block.

The REMC was approved by the Centre. Each centre is being set up at a cost of Rs 49 crore. The REMCs are being managed by Power System Operation Corporation of India Ltd. (POSOCO) at regional and national level and by SLDC at the state level, the official said.

Title: 28-year-old found dead in field
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

PRAYAGRAJ: A 28-year-old man was found dead with a bullet wound near PB College along Chak Road under Kotwali police station of Pratapgarh district on Friday.

While the motive behind the murder of Ajeet Verma, a resident of Badanpur village, is not immediately clear, circumstantial evidence indicate the youth was killed by people he knew well. Leaf plates and leftover food were found near the crime scene, police said.

According to family members, Ajeet left home around 8.30pm on Thursday to attend a function and never returned. They searched for him until morning when someone informed them about a body being found in a field on the outskirts of the village.

Title: Three-day Bundelkhand lit fest begins in Jhansi
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

JHANSI: The first Bundelkhand Literature Festival began at the Craft Fair ground near the Jhansi fort on Friday. More than two dozen literary figures from the fields of Hindi and Bundeli literature, dramatics, journalism, cinema and TV will hold discussions on various aspects of Bundeli and Hindi literature, culture and ways to promote it during the three-day event.

The inaugural session was presided over by Bundelkhand University vice-chancellor Prof JV Vaishampayan while the chief guest was Jhansi divisional commissioner Shubhash Chandra Sharma. Prominent personalities including, Maitri Pushpa, Kailash Marwariya, Raja Bundela, also attended the event.

Sharma said Jhansi was blessed to have the rich legacy of Rani Laxmibai and added that the literature festival would add to the city’s glory.

Prof JV Vaishampayan said, “Bundelkhand is one of the richest places as far as culture, literature and valour are concerned.”

Title: Inspection of Golden Threshold concludes, to be made cultural hub
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Golden Threshold at UoH has housed its arts and fine arts faculties

HYDERABAD: An INTACH team has finished a two-day inspection of Golden Threshold in Abids as part of it efforts to restore the heritage structure where the University of Hyderabad was born.

The team comprised of members from both the Delhi and Hyderabad chapters of the charitable organisation. “We have completed the process of documenting the heritage building. We will be submitting a report on its condition soon,” said Mithali Vij, conservation architect with INTACH’s architectural heritage division, Delhi.

UoH has plans to restore the heritage structure and turn it into a cultural hub. “We want to convert the main building into a museum-art gallery. We will work with different stakeholders to bring in furniture, books and documents belonging to Sarojini Naidu from different parts of the city. In addition, archaeological artifacts collected by the university’s history department can also be presented here,” said Vinod Pavarala, the chairman of Golden Threshold Committee.

The open spaces are to be used for book readings, theatre and other performances. “We will open up the space for those interested in holding cultural events,” said chairman Pavarala.

Convener for INTACH in Hyderabad Anuradha Reddy said, “We are happy that the restoration work is being taken up as the structure has been neglected. We will support the work with our technical expertise.”

The building has a rich past, having been given to the university by Sarojini Naidu's family in 1974. Mahatma Gandhi is said to have stayed here during the freedom struggle.

Title: Inform about completed & pending irri projects: HC to govt
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur bench of Bombay high court on Wednesday directed the state government to inform on the number of irrigation projects completed and pending within two weeks.

The directives came while hearing a PIL by Loknayak Bapuji Aney Smarak Samiti’s (LBASS) convener Avinash Kale through counsel Bharti Dabhadkar regarding incomplete irrigation projects that led to a spate of farmer suicides in Vidarbha over the years.

In the last hearing, the petitioner moved an amendment application demanding directives to the state government and Vidarbha Irrigation Development Corporation (VIDC) to submit a report in this regard within a specific time.

On Wednesday, the petitioner again pointed out submissions made in his amendment application after which a division bench comprising justices Ravi Deshpande and Amit Borkar directed the respondents, including secretaries of state’s Urban Development, General Administration (GAD), forest and irrigation departments, besides VIDC to file a reply.

Kale had blamed incomplete projects for a spate of farmer suicides in the region over the years, which continued till date. Citing its old PIL (No 83/2012) in the multicrore irrigation scam that was disposed on December 12, 2014, after the VIDC assured to complete all projects within new deadline, he pointed out that hardly any progress has been made since then.

The petitioner further accused VIDC of failure to complete about 45 irrigation projects within deadline in the region, thus depriving over 30 lakh farmers of facilities. He pointed out that he was a part of ‘Sinchan Shodh Yatra’ along with social workers where they visited about 16 out of 45 projects and found them incomplete, even after the new deadline.

The VIDC, in its reply earlier, listed out a slew of reasons for delay in projects’ completion. It included PAPs’ opposition, lack of environmental clearance, introduction of lift irrigation scheme (LIS), unavailability of sand, metal, rubble and other material, and staff vacancy.

The cause of delays was introspected by conducting various discussions, forming committees and all feasible results/reports are being implemented. The VIDC and government are very serious in completion of remaining 64 ongoing forest-affected projects.

Title: Anti-CAA protests: Court rejects bail plea of Babupurwa violence accused
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Security arrangements were made to avoid any untoward incident during Friday namaz in the city

KANPUR: Additional district and sessions judge, Vinay Kumar Singh, on Friday rejected the bail application of Mohd Aqeel in the Babupurwa riot case. The police had booked him for violence, arson, damage of public property and under Arms Act and Criminal Law (Amendment) Act.

Aqeel stated in his bail application that at present he is under judicial custody and in jail. He claimed in his affidavit that he was fabricated in the case as he had not committed any crime and is innocent. Babupurwa violence had taken place on December 20 last. He said by profession he is a fabricator of doors and on that day he was returning from Begumpurwa after purchasing some material.

He said when he noticed the Babupurwa area gripped by violence, he decided to go home through lanes and bylanes. In the meantime, he suffered a gun shot fired by cops and fell on the ground due to leg injury. Later, he was admitted to a hospital, and after few days he was discharged. Police later nabbed him from his house on the basis of gun shot injury, he stated in his bail application.

He requested the court to grant him bail as he had no role in the riots. He said it is his first bail application and that he has not preferred any bail application in the high court.

Opposing his bail application, ADGC Shiv Bhagwan pleaded that on December 20, after the namaz the accused along with a co-accused had hurled petrol bombs, acid bombs and bottles containing acids on the police party which caused damage to body protectors, cane shields, helmets and the vehicles. The police had used force on the order of the magistrate, the prosecution told the court.

More than a dozen cops had suffered injuries. The accused and the co-accused had burnt motorcycles of the police party. The field unit had collected empty shells of 12 bore cartridges, 315 bore cartridges and bottles used as petrol bomb and acid bomb, the ADGC argued and added the accused and the co-accused were arrested from the spot.

The judge in his order observed, " The court has gone through the evidence on record and the police report in which the police claimed that charges under section 302 were added against the accused. The evidence on record indicate that he and the co-accused were involved in the violence and with the help of crowd had damaged national property which is a serious criminal offence".

Considering the evidence, both oral and documentary, there is no ground to grant bail to the accused and his bail application is being rejected, the court said in its order.

Earlier on January 13 and February 1, the court had rejected the bail applications of accused Shahzad, Pervez, Adil and Mustaqeem.

Title: Swarup is new V-C of law univ
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Jaipur: The additional secretary of UGC Dev Swarup has been recalled by chief minister Ashok Gehlot to serve as vice-chancellor of a state varsity. Swarup, who resigned from the post of V-C Rajasthan University citing differences with the then higher education minister Kalicharan Saraf in 2014, on Thursday was made the V-C of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar Law University (DBALU) in Jaipur.

Swarup will assume office on Monday has been part of several committees on the higher education in India.

“It is a very rare chance for any educationist to be given the role of VC twice. He turned out to be the obvious choice for the state due to his UGC background which would benefit the university to a great extent,” said a government official. Swarup biggest achievement has been the successfully initiating decades old recruitment process, department-wise curriculum meet and introduced choice based credit system which somehow was not implemented due to his exit.

Talking to TOI, Swarup said, “I believe in the saying beginning is most part of any work. The law university in itself is an exciting idea. I have already asked the bar council of India for their assistance in introducing three-year and five-year integrated law program. The larger aim is to follow the legacy of Baba Sahab by producing a force of legal luminaries upholding the core values of the constitution—justice, equality and egalitarian society.”

Earlier, also the role of Swarup was not restricted to the handle the affairs of the RU but was routinely consulted to the government on higher education. Swarup while resigning in 2014 had told that differences with then minister Saraf not allowing him to carry out developmental work.

Title: Defects surface on Atal Setu, L&T asked to rectify flaws
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

GSIDC has asked the private construction firm to raise the level of the down ramp on the south side, which get... Read More

PANAJI: A little over a year after it was inaugurated, the Atal Setu ’s south side approach road leading towards Porvorim has started sinking. Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation (GSIDC) has asked L&T, which constructed the cable-stayed bridge , to undertake major rectification of the approach ramps for which the Merces-Porvorim stretch will have to be shut.

GSIDC has also asked the private construction firm to raise the level of the down ramp on the south side, which gets inundated during the monsoon.

“Three issues have been identified for rectification. We have asked L&T to close the ramps and do all the repairs, including rectification of the settlement and potholes,” a senior GSIDC official said.

The two ramps have begun to show signs of settlement, which have been built in reclaimed land and the unevenness causes vehicles to jump or jerk while approaching the bridge. GSIDC has asked Goa police traffic cell for clearance to close down parts of Atal Setu, and discussions between all stakeholders are ongoing to identify suitable dates for the closure of the ramps.

Several potholes have also surfaced across the bridge, which L&T has repaired using the patch method.

“We are not satisfied because the methodology is not proper. The entire layer of asphalt has to be removed and a new layer has to be laid,” the GSIDC official said.

It must be noted that the bridge was inaugurated on January 27, 2019, by former chief minister Manohar Parrikar . Since the defects have cropped up during the defect liability period, L&T will have to bear the cost for the rectification and repairs.

GSIDC officials said that the bridge would continue to remain open for traffic as the Ponda to Porvorim ramp will be opened in a few weeks.

Vehicles coming from Merces and heading to Porvorim and beyond will be diverted towards the two older Mandovi bridges. “The work should start as fast as possible and has to be completed before the monsoon,” the official said.

The Porvorim-Merces ramp on the southern end of the bridge tends to get waterlogged during the monsoon due to heavy rainfall and the ramp itself has shown signs of settlement resulting in a bumpy ride.

L&T bagged the contract to construct the cable-stayed bridge for Rs 403 crore, but, as on date, GSIDC has spent Rs 546.8 crore on the four-lane bridge.

Title: Arrest cops responsible for death: Family
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Jaisalmer: The uproar over the custodial death of a Dalit youth in Barmer rural police station does not seem to be dying down.

The family members and villagers are now staging a dharna outside the mortuary and have not agreed to lift the body of Jitendra Khatik. The three demands of the family members are a government job, compensation of Rs 1 crore and to arrest all police officers and employees under Section 302. They will allow the post-mortem to be conducted only when the demands are met, they said.

After shunting out Barmer SP Sharad Choudhury, the government has made Barmer DySP Vijay Singh APO. The state government has sent ADG (civil rights) Ravi Prakash Mehda to Barmer for damage control. Jodhpur range IG Navjyoti Gogoi and Barmer collector Anshdeep have met the family members and assured all possible assistance and action as per rules.

The father of the deceased said he has not eaten anything for the last 36 hours, while police officers are giving empty assurances as none of the culprits have not been arrested so far and no economic assistance has been announced. “Till the accused policemen are arrested, we will not allow post-mortem,” he said.

Collector Anshdeep admitted that there has been some carelessness on part of police. He said all efforts are being made to get justice for the family and talks are on and for financial assistance.

Barmer additional DGP Ravi Prakash Mehda said keeping the youth in illegal custody was a mistake by police. As the matter is with CID CB, judicial investigation will soon take place. The culprits will not be spared, he added.

Police official said brother of deceased has lodged case against all police personal of Rural Police in the Act 143, 342, 302 and SC ST Act. Thereafter police has sent to lines 2 ASI, 2 head constable & 14 constable. Preliminary investigation of the case has been done by Balotra additional SP.

It can be noted that this is the second custodial death in the last four months in Barmer. Earlier, an RTI activist died in custody at Balotra police station.

Title: DMC shuts the only legal slaughterhouse in Doon
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Dehradun: The slaughterhouse run by Dehradun Municipal Corporation ( DMC ) in Bhandari Bagh has been locked by the civic body. The facility was in use primarily for slaughtering goats.

With this lockdown, Dehradun now doesn’t have any authorised slaughterhouse.

Uttarakhand high court had recently directed the Food & Drug Administration to run an inspection drive in the meat shops of Dehradun to check whether they are following due norms or not.

Following the HC order, several raids were conducted and several meat shops who were found violating FSSAI norms were reprimanded. The FSSAI norms say that slaughtering of fowl or any other animal can’t take place inside the shops.

Meanwhile, the move to shut down the only legal slaughterhouse by the DMC was objected to by a few BJP MLAs including former mayor and Dharampur legislator Vinod Chamoli. “This will lead to illegal slaughterhouses flourishing and unchecked meat being sold.”

Chamoli added that “with diseases like swine flu and coronavirus prevailing, it is important that hygienic and properly checked meat is available to people and therefore, closing down of a legal abattoir is not a good step taken by the civic body.”

Title: CP gives first aid to woman
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Hyderabad: A woman was injured in an accident on Ghatkesar- Nagaram Main Road at around 3 pm on Friday. She was provided first aid by the commissioner of police of Rachakonda, Mahesh Bhagwat, and taken to a hospital nearby.

The injured, Nalla Rani, a housewife from Nagaram, was travelling on her two-wheeler to Dammaiguda to pick up her children from school when she rammed into an auto. The auto driver has applied brakes suddenly. Bhagwat, who was on his way to Neredmet, saw the incident and took her to Vijaya Hospital, Nagaram, in his escort vehicle.

The officer also paid Rs 2,000 to the hospital for initial treatment and instructed the local patrol team to take care of her.

Title: Pawar, Metro trade charges over medical bills
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Nagpur: Jai Jawan Jai Kisan leader Prashant Pawar on Thursday alleged that MahaMetro’s Brijesh Dixit’s appointment was illegal and he had illegally got medical bills worth Rs64 lakh reimbursed. MahaMetro spokesperson denied that the appointment was illegal adding that the expenses was high because Dixit’s wife was admitted to a Mumbai hospital.

The spokesperson said that Pawar had stooped very low by terming medical expenses of the wife of an officer as corruption. “We get 100% reimbursement if the officer or his dependants are admitted to a hospital. If the person is not admitted, we get 90% reimbursement. In Dixit’s case, the bills were sanctioned, approved, audited and admitted. The amount was Rs30.44 lakh and not Rs64 lakh,” he added.

Pawar had claimed that Dixit’s medical expense reimbursement limit could not be more than Rs10 lakh to Rs20 lakh and hence Rs64 lakh was illegal. The Metro spokesperson said that this figure also included foreign service contribution, club membership fee, camp office rent, travel allowance, entertainment allowance and peon allowance. “The camp office rent of Rs31.80 lakh has been added to Dixit’s account,” he added.

On why the new government was not probing into his allegations, Pawar alleged that deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar and guardian minister Nitin Raut were shielding the corrupt officials as they too had vested interests. He however, added that a MLA would raise the issue in state assembly next week and the government would announce an enquiry.

Title: Farmer found murdered in Etawah field
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

KANPUR: A farmer was found murdered in Ranipura village under the limits of Sahson police area of Etawah district on Friday morning.

According to the police, Raju Yadav (45) was shot by some unidentified person on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday. Some locals spotted his body lying in his field on Friday morning and informed his family members who then alerted the police.

Superintendent of police (Rural) Omveer Singh reached the site to take stock of the situation. A forensic team also rushed to the spot. Raju’s family members said that he used to keep a licensed rifle, belonging to his brother, with him. The rifle was also found near the body. The family said that Raju, like every day, had gone to guard his field on Thursday night.

On the complaint of the family, an FIR under section 302 ( murder ) has been lodged against unidentified assailant, said the SP. The body was sent for post-mortem. Police said, “It appears that Raju was killed when he was sleeping. We are investigating the matter.”

Title: NIT to introduce MTech course on waste mgmt
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Warangal: The National Institute of Technology, Warangal, is set to launch an MTech program in waste management with 20 seats. The announcement was made by the institute director NV Ramana Rao on Friday. “Waste management practices are the need of the hour. The job opportunities in this sector are huge,” said chief guest S Sairam, general manager (Environment and Pollution Control) Nuclear Fuel Complex, Hyderabad. TNN

Title: Goa: Woman’s body fished out from river
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

POINGUINIM: A body of a woman was fished out from the river at Tarir Rajbhag, Canacona on Friday.

Police said that the woman was identified as Deepa Shivaji Dessai, 53, a resident of Patnem , Canacona.

Police said that a passerby spotted the body floating in the river and informed the police who immediately rushed to the spot, and with the help of Canacona fire and emergency services personnel retrieved the corpse.

After the police conducted the panchanama, the body was sent to the Margao morgue for autopsy which will be conducted on Saturday, Canacona PI Tukaram Chawan said.

The police were informed by the woman’s father and brother that she was mentally unsound and would move out of the house at any given time. Assuming that she would be somewhere in the vicinity, the family later learnt that her body was found floating in the river.

PSI Dhiraj Devidas is further investigating the case.

Title: HC transfers case of 17-year-old boy missing to CB-CID
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Madras high court has transferred a boy missing case to the CB-CID, after his father filed a habeas corpus petition (HCP) seeking to find his son who went missing in Pudukottai district last year.

In his petition, N Ganesan, an advocate and resident of Pudukottai district, stated that he has two children Shanmugapriyan , 17, and a 15-year-old daughter. On Septembr 4, 2019, his son, who was studying Class XII did not return home after school.

After searching for him at several places, Ganesan lodged a complaint at the Pudukottai Town police station. Though the police registered a man missing complaint, there was no progress in finding his son.

He stated that when he was searching for his son in Coimbatore district , a few hotel employees identified his son’s photo and said that he had approached the hotels seeking employment. Though he informed about these developments to the police, no effective steps were taken by them to find out the whereabouts of his son.

Hence, the petitioner filed a HCP before the high court Madurai bench. When the case was taken up for hearing on Thursday, a division bench of justice T Raja and justice B Pugalendhi transferred the case to the CB-CID.

Title: Telangana CM K Chandrasekhar Rao presents ‘Ghilaf’ for Ajmer dargah Urs
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

K Chandrasekhar Rao

HYDERABAD: Telangana chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Friday handed over to the officials and clergy the ‘Ghilaf’, a decorated colourful fabric, to be offered at Khwaja Gharib Nawaz Hazrat Moinuddin Chisty Rahmatullah Alaihi Ajmer Sharif dargah during the ongoing annual Urs celebrations, on behalf of the state government.

The chief minister offered prayers while handing over the ghilaf to Telangana State Wakf Board members and Muslim clergy at Pragati Bhavan.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Threatened by stalker, woman attempts suicide
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

KANPUR: A woman in Kannauj district attempted suicide after a local, who was earlier arrested for stalking her, threatened to kill her for seeking police help and getting him arrested.

The woman tried to end her life by hanging self from ceiling of her room on Thursday but was saved and admitted to Tirwa Medical college in a critical state. Police have launched a search and are on the lookout for the accused, identified as Shailendra, a resident of Kudhwa village.

The woman lives with her children at her in-laws’ place while her husband works in some other state. According to the police, the accused used to follow the woman forcing her to reciprocate his love. On February 22, he barged into her house and harassed her following which the woman filed a complaint against him. Accused was arrested on February 25 and sent to jail.

“After procuring bail, on February 27 he reached the woman’s house and allegedly threatened her with dire consequences in front of her children. Panicked woman locked herself in a room and tried to commit suicide by hanging herself from the ceiling of her room,” said inspector Taalgram Vinod Kumar Mishra. He added, “On hearimg the noise, her in-laws rushed to her room and rescued her. They admitted her to a nearby CHC from where doctors referred her to Tirwa medical college. The police, following a complaint by woman’s father-in-law, have booked Shailendra under relevant sections of IPC and launched a search to make his arrest possible.

Title: Tussle within BJP in Tivim over zilla seat
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Panaji: In an indication that all is not well in BJP in some of the ten constituencies from where Congress MLAs joined BJP last year, former BJP legislator Kiran Kandolkar has demanded the party ticket for his wife in the forthcoming zilla panchayat polls.

Kandolkar said he was not against the induction of Nilkant Halarnkar into the party last July in party's interest, but lamented that there is disenchantment among the cadre now. He expressed confidence that party will nominate his wife for the polls. “She will surely contest,” he said

Title: Independent MLA seeks detail on the expenses incurred on Bungalow no 13
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Jaipur: Independent MLA Sanyam Lodha on Monday asked the state government to divulge details on the expenses incurred on Bungalow No. 13 on Civil Lines, which is allotted to former chief minister Vasundhara Raje.

He took a dig on chief minister Ashok Gehlot, the state government and the BJP on their allegations and counter allegations.

Lodha was speaking over demands for grants for revenue and other departments at state legislative assembly on Friday. “Former BJP leader Ghanshyam Tiwari was raising the issue of bungalow no 13 for a long time and later he joined the Congress due to his differences. I urge the state government to inform how much expenses were incurred on Bungalow no. 13,” Lodha said.

Recalling a press conference by chief minister Ashok Gehlot while the latter was in opposition, Lodha, said, “In January, 2016, when Gehlot was not a chief minister, he had organised a press conference and had alleged that phones of political leaders and bureaucrats were tapped. He had then maintained that then commissioner of police, JDA commissioner and collector were involved in scams. Now your government is incumbent for the past 15 to 16 months, so the state government should table a report in this regard to clarify whose phones were tapped and who was involved in the scam,” Lodha added.

Title: Bhopal: RPF cyber cell to check e-crimes on trains, stations
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Government Railway Police (GRP) still has the right to register cases under IPC in train theft, dispute, assault and other law and order related matters. Soon these powers can be given to Railway Protection Force (RPF). Keeping this in view, the RPF is preparing a cyber cell at the divisional level. Bhopal division will be the first to form such a cyber cell among the three divisions of West Central Railway.

Sources said that initially the task of the cyber cell will be to investigate the crimes registered under the Railway Act. Apart from this, they will hand over the complete details of the culprit to the GRP in mobile theft incidents. At the same time, when the RPF gets the rights of action under Section 378, 379, 380 of the IPC, then the usefulness of this cyber cell will increase even more, stated the officials.

Bhopal division will be the first to form such a cyber cell among the three divisions of West Central Railway.

Officials said that high-end computers will be bought for the cyber cell. Besides, they will also buy software for data analysis. Many a times, in the crimes registered under the Railway Act, issue is the location and call details of the mobile tower. In such situation, cyber cell will help in solving the case. Sources added that cyber cell will start by the end of March.

After the formation of the cell, RPF should take action in the incidents of theft of mobile phones in rail.

Along with this, it will also help to prevent and investigate cyber attacks on the railways. Besides, it will also monitor gangs involved in black-marketing of e-ticket. Training of RPF personnel is also going to begin for this. A senior official of RPF without quoting his name said that first RPF cyber cell of West Central Zone will be ready in Bhopal division.

Title: Kalsotsav in Mayem suspended fearing violence
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Bicholim: The Kalsotsav festivities of Maya Kelbai Devasthan from Mayem village in Bicholim taluka have been suspended anticipating a law and order problem. Another reason was the letter submitted by Bicholim police station authorities to Bicholim deputy collector Jyoti Kumari about having lack of police force to control the situation in case the need arose.

This compelled the deputy collector to pass an order suspending the festivities. It has directed both parties to maintain status quo from February 28 to March 7. This was informed by Bicholim mamlatdar Pravinjay Pandit.

Uncertainty prevailed over the annual Kalsotsav festival which was scheduled to begin on Friday, with the two opposing communities vying to host the celebrations unable to reach a compromise. The groups met the Bicholim deputy collector Jyoti Kumari on Thursday, and the final call on whether the festival will commence was taken on Friday.

Festivities were scheduled to take place from February 28 to March 7. Bicholim mamlatdar Pravinjay Pandit had passed an order last week that the Kalsotsav festivities will be hosted by the Parab Gaonkar community. The other group, comprising Naik Gaonkar, Gosavi Gaonkar, Gawas Gaonkar and Karbotkar Gaonkar communities, had said that the mamlatdar’s order was one-sided.

“The celebration of Kalsotsav is the right of every community and not just the Parab Gaonkar community,” they said. Last year, the authorities had cancelled the festival, fearing a law and order problem.

Meanwhile, the Parab Gaonkar community maintained that order was passed at the last hour and hence they could not take any action.

Title: Notice to 3 pvt hosps for no H1N1 isolation wards
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Meerut: As a fallout of the swine flu outbreak in the district, the Meerut health department inspected various hospitals and found no isolation ward in three private ones. Notice has been issued to the hospitals concerned. At the same time, the department conducted a sensitization session in this regard on Friday, thereby warning all hospitals about the risks of treating swine flu patients along with other patients.

“An inspection was conducted by health teams at three private hospitals. In all the three hospitals, no isolation ward was found for swine flu patients. Not just this, they did not have any infection control measures in place, instruction for which have been issued by the health department from time to time. A notice has been issued to all the three hospitals,” said Dr Raj Kumar, Meerut chief medical officer.

In this backdrop, a meeting of Nursing Home Association was called on Friday by the chief medical officer. “Strict instructions have been given to ensure that isolation wards are set up in each hospital without fail and all possible control measures are taken. If the instructions are not followed, strict action will be taken against the hospitals concerned,” said Dr Raj Kumar.

TOI had earlier reported that the health department had asked all the government as well as private hospitals to set up isolation wards for swine flu patients so that other patients admitted here – who are already have low immunity – do not catch infection. The step will even keep the hospital staff safe.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Madhya Pradesh to keep 6-month stock of drugs
Content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: In the wake of the coronavirus scare , the Madhya Pradesh government will purchase and store medicines — worth approximately Rs 120 crore — for six months.The move comes as it is suspected that supplies may be affected as most of the ingredients used for making tablets come from China.“We have medicine stocks for two months. As of now, there is no shortage, but if the situation continues, there may be a shortage after two months. That’s because a majority of the ingredients used for manufacturing medicines come from China. Thus, as a precautionary measure, we are going to stock medicines for six months. We already have two months’ stock, so stock for another four months is being purchased,” Dr J Vijaykumar, managing director of Madhya Pradesh Public Health Services Corporation Limited (MPPHSCL), told TOI.MPPHSCL is a state government-run company. One of the key objectives of MPPHSCL is to act as the central procurement agency for all essential drugs and equipment for all public healthcare institutions under the health department.“Annually, our medicine budget is around Rs 350 crore, thus cost of stock for four months would be approximately around Rs 120 crore. Tenders would be issued in a couple of days and deadline for supply will be within one month,” VIjaykumar said. However, private chemists say that as of now, there is no apparent scarcity, though there is some spike in prices.“Supplies are normal as of now and scarcity is not evident. Though prices have slightly gone up, but that is a normal activity,” president of MP Chemists’ Association, Lalit Jain, told TOI.It is noteworthy that so far more than 20 suspected corona virus patients have been identified in Madhya Pradesh, but no one has tested positive till now. Currently, a medical student who studied in Wuhan, China, is under ‘community surveillance in Bhopal’s Karond area along with a dozen others who are also under community surveillance.Across India, a total of 23,531passengers with a travel history to China in the recent past are currently under community surveillance through IDSP, according to the Union ministry of health and family welfare. There are around 700 such cases in MP, according to estimates.

Title: CM Edappadi K Palaniswami writes to MEA to bring back fishers stranded in Iran
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

CM Edappadi K Palaniswami

MADURAI: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Friday wrote to external affairs minister S Jaishankar to direct the Indian Embassy in Iran to make arrangements for the safe and immediate return of Indian fishermen stranded in that country due to Covid-19 outbreak.

The CM stated that flight cancellations because of the outbreak have left 450 Indian fishermen — 300 of them from Tamil Nadu — stranded in Iran. Employed in vessels operating in Port Kish , Cheeru and other places, the fishermen want to be evacuated, he added. Meanwhile, fear is gripping the fishermen some of whom hail from Kanyakumari. “We are struggling to manage with the limited water resources. Our boat has run out of water,” one of them, M Sahaya Askar, told TOI.

He said that schools and even mosques have been closed at many places in Iran but fishermen live in very poor conditions and will not be having access to proper quarantine facilities. “We have not even been provided with masks to boost our morale. We want to return home,” he added. Since there is no work permit to work as fishermen in Iran, most fishermen go to Dubai and take a visiting visa to Iran. The catch is sold in Dubai and hence the visiting visa is renewed every few months.

On Friday three boats with more than 20 Indian fishermen tried to enter Dubai as they have a Dubai visa but they were stopped in the sea by the authorities as the men worked in Iran. “In coordination with the fishermen in Iran and their village committees and through associations we have gathered the names of 252 Indian fishermen till Friday. Nearly 200 are from Kanyakumari district – predominantly from Kadiaoattanam and Rajakkamangalam Thurai coast villages,” Meenavar Orunginaipu Sangam secretary Charles Johnson said.

Title: 36-year-old gets death sentence in 2016 triple murder case
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

TENKASI: A 36-year-old man, who was found guilty of committing a triple murder in 2016, has been awarded death sentence by the Tenkasi additional district court on Friday.

The accused, N Muthuraj alias Andavar of Nettur village near Alangulam in Tenkasi district murdered M Pechithaye, 48, her daughter M Mari, 19, and Pechithaye’s father, Govindasamy, 75, on February 16, 2016.

Additional public prosecutor (APP) S Ramachandran told TOI that Muthuraj, a rowdy element had many cases registered against him. He was in jail in connection with another case and was released only about a week before he committed the brutal murders.

According to him, on February 12, 2016, Muthuraj tried to misbehave with the 21-year-old eldest daughter of Pechithaye. The latter lodged a complaint with the Alangulam DSP. On February 16, at around 3.45pm, when Pechithaye and a few other women who are fellow workers under the Mahatma Gandhi national rural employment guarantee scheme, were returning home on the Thenvadal main road, Muthuraj picked up a quarrel with her for lodging the police complaint.

He then attacked her with a machete resulting in her death. “He also attacked Pechithaye’s younger daughter Mari when she tried to protect her mother. Not content, he went to the village and murdered Govindasamy, who was grazing his cattle, by attacking him multiple times with the machete,” Ramachandran said.

The Alangulam police registered a case under sections 302 (punishment for murder), 341 (punishment for wrongful restraint) and 506(ii) (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and the case was tried before the Tenkasi additional district court. “Though there were many eyewitnesses, some women turned hostile as the accused threatened them in the court,” Ramachandran said.

However, Pechithaye’s brother Murugan, 25, and his friend Govindasamy testified against Muthuraj. On completion of trial, additional district judge C Vijayakumar awarded him death sentence for the triple murder and two years and one month imprisonment for the other sections under which he was booked.

Title: Meerut teacher bags nat’l awards for popularizing science among kids
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Meerut: It was a proud moment for Meerut, when President Ram Nath Kovind awarded a city-based teacher with two national awards on National Science Day at Vigyan Bhavan in Delhi on Friday.

Deepak Sharma, a city-based scientist, teacher and programme coordinator for the district science club, was awarded the national award for ‘Outstanding Efforts in Science and Technology Popularization Among Children’ and ‘Outstanding Work in Science Media & Journalism’.

Sharma has come up with inventions and discoveries, and promoting science among children.

“It was an honour of sorts to get two national awards at the same platform. It seemed liked my hard work through all these years paid off. It was a day that I will cherish throughout my life,” said Sharma.

Sharma is a science teacher at N.A.S. Inter College, Meerut. He was in the news in June 2015 for coming up with the initiative of Vigyan Ghar – wherein 20 students between the age group of 14 years and 18 years from across the country stayed under the same roof for 10 days and performed science-based practicals in a fun way. He is also known in the city for his science channel, ‘Vigyan Aao Karke Sikhe’, and for his science magazine.

Title: Govt lifts export ban, onion starts fetching higher rates at Lasalgaon
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Nashik: With the Centre announcing removal of ban on onion exports on Wednesday, the average wholesale price of the produce at Lasalgaon APMC shot up by Rs 400 per quintal in a day.

The Lasalgaon APMC, country’s largest wholesale onion market, sets the trend for nationwide onion rates. On Thursday, the average wholesale onion price was recorded at Rs 2,150 per quintal as against Rs 1,750 per quintal on Tuesday.

Union minister Ramvilas Paswan on Wednesday tweeted about the Centre’s decision to withdraw ban on onion export. Maharashtra Onion Growers’ Association on Thursday criticised the government for making the announcement, but not putting it into effect.

“The Centre has only announced withdrawal of the ban on onion export. It has still not issued any notification. The ban will not be withdrawn until a notification is issued by the Centre,” said Bharat Dighole, state president of the association.

The Centre had imposed ban on onion export in September last year after the average wholesale onion prices shot up. Moreover, a restriction on stock limit of 500 quintal was also put on the wholesalers and 100 quintal for retailers.

Following demand from onion traders and farmers, the Centre recently reduced the stock limit to 250 quintal for wholesalers and 50 quintal for retailers.

Meanwhile, on Thursday, the minimum and maximum wholesale onion prices were recorded at Rs 1,000 and Rs 2,391 per quintal, respectively. Around 20,000 quintals of onions were auctioned at Lasalgaon .

The average wholesale onion price had recorded an all-time high of Rs 8,625 per quintal on December 16 last year due to scarcity. Nearly 75% of the kharif plantation was damaged due to the incessant rains in September and October.

Title: BJP MLA writes to CM seeking land ownership rights for Hindu refugees in Bijnor’s Badhapur
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Bijnor: Unable to get land ownership rights ever since they were refuge by the government after the 1947 Partition, the Hindus and Sikhs living in Badhapur area of Bijnor are a worried lot even after 73 years. Now, BJP MLA from Badhapur, Kunwar Sushant Singh, has come out in their support and has written to Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath demanding that these people be given ownership rights of the land where they have been living for years now. Singh had also managed to get the support of 203 other MLAs for the cause and got their signatures on the application.

According to villagers, scores of families from Pakistan migrated to India during the Partition. Some were rehabilitated in Barhapur area, around 60 km away from the district headquarters. These refugees were provided land so that they could earning their livelihood. The land was barren and some had trees and shrubs at that time. These families worked hard and prepared the land for agriculture. Since then, they have been cultivating the land but do not have ownership rights.

As they do not have ownership rights, they are unable to avail of government's schemes for farmers. They are not even provided with supply tickets to sell sugarcane produce to mills, and this forces them to sell their crop outside at throwaway prices.

Talking to TOI, Tara Singh, husband of village head of Champatpur Soma Rani, narrated the grievances of the villagers: “There are 13 villages -- including Mudpuri, Chanmpatpur, Bhogpur, Prempuri, Kuakheda, Chakpuri, Rasulabad, Harevali, Harevala, Khijarpur, Nawabpura, Katarmal and Shahnagar etc -- in Barhapur area, where refugees from Pakistan were settled by the government.”

“We were persecuted in Pakistan and compelled to flee that country. Some of members of these families were killed in the riots and some got separated. A train brought us to Nagina railway station and from here we came to Barhapur. Each family was given four to five acres of land. Land is the only source of income for us. Earlier, we were given land records by the administration but it was stopped 13 years ago. Since then, we have not been given any benefit under government's agriculture schemes. We are forced to sell our produce at throwaway prices.”

“We have been demanding ownership of the land since long but our demands have fallen on deaf ears. Now, we have contacted Barhapur MLA Sushant Kumar to provide us relief. There are over 20,000 villagers who are fighting for ownership of land in their possession.” said Tara Singh.

Sushant Kumar Singh, MLA from Barhapur assembly segment in Bijnor district, said, “I have drafted an application some days ago. I also contacted 203 MLAs of UP and they have extended their support to the demands of these villagers. These MLAs also signed the application which I have handed over to chief minister Yogi Adityanath urging that ownership of land be given to these villagers on the line of forest nomads. I hope the chief minister will pay heed to the grievances of the villagers.”

Title: 2 scribes in UP’s Bulandshahr booked for ‘inflammatory’ social media posts
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Meerut: Two local journalists, who posted videos on social media platforms showing stones and other construction material on the rooftops of three houses of a community in Bulandshahr, were on Friday booked by police.

Taking note of the “sensational and inflammatory” posts against the backdrop of communal riots in neighbouring Delhi, police filed the FIR.

The FIR under IPC sections 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), 295 (Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class) and section 67 Information Technology Act was registered at Kotwali City police station of Bulandshahr. An unidentified person was also made an accused in the case.

Both the reporters work for local TV news channels.

The accused scribes have contested the claims of police.

“In the video footages of drone surveillance during Friday prayers, stones were spotted on rooftops of three houses, which were later removed. That’s what we showed. Police now claim that our intention was to flare up tension when we were just doing our job,” one of the reporters said.

But, the complaint on the basis of which the FIR was registered, read, “Videos and inflammatory content aimed at flaring communal tension was posted on YouTube and Facebook. A normal incident was sensationalized to hurt sentiments of a community."

Title: MGP eyes 20 ZP seats, to decide on tie-up with like-minded parties
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Panaji: The MGP intends to contest 20 zilla panchayat constituencies and is expected to announce the names of its candidates on Saturday, said lone party MLA Ramkrishna Dhavalikar here on Friday. Ponda, Pernem, Dharbandora and Bicholim talukas are some of the zones that MGP is eyeing.

The former PWD minister said the party’s executive committee had already met and deliberated over the names of the candidates for the ZP constituencies where the party intends to challenge BJP.

“Our committee has met and I think the party will contest the ZP elections in 20 constituencies. The committee will meet tomorrow and declare the names of the candidates,” said Dhavalikar.

He said that the party had received feelers from other political parties for an alliance for the ZP elections, but no final seat-sharing agreement had been arrived at.

“Even the decision on an alliance has not been taken, but like-minded parties who are with us, we will look into it,’ said Dhavalikar.

He said that the party had received a lot of interest from candidates and other political parties too. Dhavalikar also said that the ongoing resentment against BJP could work in favour of all the parties that take on the saffron party.

“I personally feel that all the opposition parties should come together. In the ZP elections, MGP, Congress and those who stand with these parties will fare well. If all these parties come together, it will be even better,” he said.

He said that MGP will focus on Mhadei water dispute, agriculture, industries and unemployment while campaigning for the polls.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Tamil Nadu crew member yet to return from quarantined ship
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Of the five crew members from Tamil Nadu who were on board COVID-19 quarantined ship Diamond Princess at Yokohama in Japan for more than three weeks only four have returned to India. Anbalagan, a crew member from Madurai who is among the Indians in a quarantine camp in Haryana, told TOI that a crew member from Kovilpatti in Tuticorin district was not in his camp.

The 138 Indians on board the ship included five from Tamil Nadu – one each from Madurai, Tuticorin, Trichy, Coimbatore and Chengalpattu districts. According to the Indian embassy in Japan, 16 of them tested positive for COVID-19 over a period of time and were taken to off shore quarantine facilities.

On Wednesday evening, 119 Indian crew members who tested negative for COVID-19 were taken from the ship at Yokohama to the airport by bus and flown to Delhi. On reaching India on Thursday morning, they were then taken to the defence camp for a 14-day mandatory quarantine.

“We all assumed that all the Indian crew members, including the five Tamil Nadu crew, have returned. I could not find the crew member from Kovilpatti in the camp. I was told by fellow crew members that he had tested positive for COVID-19,” Anbalagan said on Friday night.

He said the missing member joined work in the ship only a month ago due to which others were not close to him. “It is not confirmed if he is affected. But we could not find him here,” he added, expressing the hope he would be back home soon.
