Title: SP’s personal letter moves top Naxal cadre to surrender with AK-47
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Along with an AK-47, Vilas Kolha also deposited three magazines and 35 cartridges

Nagpur: A letter penned by SP, Gadchiroli, Shailesh Balkawade seems to have done what the force under him could not with their advanced firepower. Without a bullet being fired, Balkawade’s letter heartfelt letter, offering all help after surrender, moved Maoist commander-in-chief Vilas Kolha so much that he laid down arms on Friday. This has delivered an unprecedented setback to the four-decade old rebel movement in the tribal district.

Kolha, 44, working as Divisional Committee Member (DVC) of Chatgaon dalam before leaving the post, became the first cadre of any rank in Maharashtra to surrender with an AK-47 assault rifle. He also deposited three magazines and 35 cartridges.

Kolha had almost Rs20 lakh rewards on him in Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh, and 147 offences registered against him. The offences against him include 22 murders and several firing cases on police, apart from masterminding the Jambhulkheda blast last year where 14 cops and a civilian were killed. He was also behind the heavy setbacks to police in 2009, when 51 police personnel were killed.

Kolha had joined the movement through Etapalli dalam in 2000 and rose to prominence with his daredevil planning, operational acumen, strategic manoeuvring and aggressive approach. It’s learnt Kolha had recently had differences with the party over his inaction during the last year’s elections, and also due to depleting strength of Maoists in the north.

Kolha, one of the most dreaded DVC, commanding a horde of dalam of north Gadchiroli, had a change of heart after receiving a personalized letter from Balkawade in November last year. The IPS officer had managed to send the letter to Kolha through some acquaintances and family members. He had assured to ensure all possible benefits under government’s surrender scheme, and his personal support to set up a life in the mainstream.

It’s learnt Kolha sneaked out from a hideout in the Maoists’ guerrilla base at Abhujmadh with the weapon to surrender. He was attending a meeting when he decided to leave the Naxals.

Balkawade said he sent a second letter after they learnt Kolha had already left the outfit, and was on his way to meet police. “Kolha was miffed with allegations of non-performance by Prabhakar of Dandakaranya Special Zonal Committee (DKSZC). He had already left the outfit when I sent him my second letter, just to confirm his decision to surrender. He then came to us through an intermediary,” he said.

Balkawade said Kolha’s name was taken in the same breath as other senior DVCs like Narmada (now arrested in Jambhulkheda blast case), Sainath (eliminated in Kasnasur encounter), Aitu (surrendered in Telangana) and Ramko (killed in Gundurvahi encounter). “Four DVCs have surrendered so far since 2018 and one (Ramko) was neutralized,” he said.

Under Balkawade, 35 Maoists and their supporters have surrendered in last couple of years. He has written to several other top Maoists to surrender. “Last year, the entire Chatgaon dalam had surrendered. Kolha was shifted as DVC of Chatgaon to rebuild the dalam,” he said. “Several other dalam leaders and cadres are also expected to leave after Kolha,” he said.

Title: 4 officials suspended for poor property assessment
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Kolhapur: Four officials of the property tax department were suspended by civic chief Mallinath Kalshetti on Friday over faulty assessment of properties leading to huge revenue loss for the civic body.

One of the officials, Diwakar Karande, was the chief property tax superintendent and now the town secretary of the KMC. Others — Aniruddha Shetye, Nitin Nandwalkar and Vijay Khot — were tax superintendents in the property tax department.

Two months ago, Kalshetti had received several complaints stating that the assessment of property tax of many of the properties in the city was faulty. A three-member panel was formed to investigate the complaints.

After investigation it came to the fore that the officials were responsible for faulty assessment of properties for the last several years.

A senior KMC official said, “Suspension orders of all four officials have been signed by the civic chief. Last week, the officials replied to the show-cause notice, but their replies were not satisfactory. The investigation of the panel has found huge loss of revenue. The system of registering and assessing the property will be scrutinised once again. The digital system was closed for carrying out investigation. At present, the panel has scrutinised only few complaints and in the next couple of weeks more cases will be investigated.”

The panel members, however, have not mentioned the figure of the actual loss caused by irregularities of these officers.

“We have given orders to the property tax department to re-examine the assessment of the properties and change it as per actual assessment. Currently, no decision to recover the dues from property owners has been taken. We have found that the owners were hand-in-glove with these officials to save taxes,” said the official speaking anonymously.

Title: Environment expert likely to be sacked from KMC panels
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Kolhapur: The corporators in the standing committee have decided to sack environmental expert Uday Gaikwad from three panels of the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC).

Gaikwad has been on the KMC’s panels for several years. He is the member on the panels tree authority committee, heritage committee and Kirnotsav committee. The tree authority committee looks after protection of the trees, issuing permissions for tree cutting and carrying out tree census. The heritage committee looks after conservation and protection of heritage site whereas the Kirnotsav committee was set up to study the obstacles in the way of sun rays falling on idol of goddess in Mahalaxmi temple.

Sandip Kawale, chairman of the committee, said, “The corporators have levelled several allegations against Gaikwad. He does not have appropriate qualifications to be a member of all these committees. Also, he has been accused of the delays in getting permissions for tree cutting and taking the official files of the committees to his house. All the corporators agreed to pass the resolution to drop him from all the panels either in the upcoming standing committee meeting or the general body meeting.”

Gaikwad is considered as one of the few environmental experts in the city. In the past, he has faced the wrath of corporators over drafting of environment status report (ESR) of the KMC stating that the reports are same for every year with just the figures changed. After the allegations, the KMC had hired a new agency to draft the ESR.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Online rumours pull chicken sales down by 50% in Kolkata
Content:
The decline in egg and chicken sales due to rumours has accounted for a loss of Rs 300 crore

KOLKATA: Fake posts and rumours doing the rounds on social media that chicken spread novel coronavirus are reportedly taking a toll on sales in Kolkata, logging a decline of 30% to 50%.Blaming the drop in purchase on these rumours, traders said there might be no truth in such forwards, but consumers were being influenced by them and staying away from chicken shops. “We have been trying to convince the customers, especially the regular ones, that what they’re reading on Facebook and other social media are nothing but rumours. Our sales have hit rock bottom,” said a trader, adding that the last time their sales dipped was during the bird flu scare.West Bengal Poultry Federation general secretary Madan Mohan Maity said the problem surfaced a fortnight ago but over the past five days, sales dropped by 40% and prices 20%-30%. “The decline in egg and chicken sales due to rumours has accounted for a loss of Rs 300 crore. Wholesale prices of chicken have gone down by 50% in the past month,” he said. Kolkata consumes around 60 lakh kg chicken a week or an average of 8.6 lakh kg a day. Following the scare, the weekly consumption has come down to 24 lakh kg a week or 3.5 lakh kg a day.Lake Market chicken retailer Satyajit Sinha Roy said, “Every day, I worry how much further the sales would dip. My daily turnover has declined by 30% over the past 15 days. Sales didn’t increase even after we reduced prices. A fortnight ago, a whole chicken sold for Rs 100 a kg. I am now offering a whole chicken at Rs 80 a kg. Dressed-chicken was priced at Rs 180 a kg a fortnight ago. It is now on offer for Rs 160 a kg. But still, we have few takers.” Echoing him, Manicktala trader Sudhakar Dhali said, “Our sales have halved. Till 15 days ago, we would sell 400kg-500kg a day. Reducing prices by Rs 30-35/kg on an average has not improved sales.” Manicktala Market Committee joint secretary Bijoy Sahu said, “This rumour about coronavirus spreading from chicken is hurting business. Sales have been consistently declining. Things haven’t improved even after traders reduced prices.”Some citizens may not completely believe the rumours, but they don’t seem ready to ignore it either. Housewife Jayotee Mukherjee said, “It looks like a rumour, but I have kept chicken out of my shopping list. I am not taking any risk since I have kids and elderly people at home.”

Title: Carnatic musician shores up primary school he studied in
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Hassan: Beginning with contributing computers and building washrooms, renowned Carnatic vocalist RK Padmanabha has now added three digitised classrooms to the primary school he went to in Rudrapatna in Arkalgud. The government school, which started in 1931, bears its famous alumnus’ stamp as well: a permanent stage for cultural activities.

The village of Rudrapatna, on the banks of the Kaveri, is home to several Carnatic music artistes, including Vidwan Padmanabha. Located some 27km from the taluk centre, facilities were hard to come by for its government primary school.

Spread over 2.5 acres, the school has all of six teachers, including an in-charge headmaster, and 141 students from Classes 1 to 7. It does not have a kindergarten section or English medium of instruction.

Padmanabha first came to know of the poor state of his school in 2014 and gave computers and UPS units for students. Over the years, he helped build washrooms for boys and girls and developed a garden on the campus. To ensure the village continued to nurture talent, he commissioned a permanent stage, ‘Rangavedike’, for cultural activities.

Last Dasara, the musician joined efforts with Ocwen Financial Solutions Private Limited, and helped build three classrooms with overhead projectors, white boards and sound systems. The Vidwan also donated band instruments, a printer, water filter and contributed for a borewell.

Padmanabha’s brother, RK Srinivas, donated Rs 1 lakh to expand the garden. Among the maestro’s friends, Brigadier Sitaramayya set up a welcome board while engineer Rajegowda contributed towards the sound systems. The gram panchayat has put up concrete fencing along the boundary.

“I have donated more than Rs 10 lakh for the school. My friend has also contributed around Rs 15 lakh through sharing his company’s profits,” said Padmanabha.

Students are enjoying the vibrant environment in the school – while the windows are named after Kannada Jnanpith winners, there is a Nali Kali classroom for students of Classes 1 to 3 to engage in fun learning and computer lab for all. The school walls are also painted with informative messages and images.

Title: Man misfires rifle, bullet kills mother, arrested
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Kolhapur: The Shahuwadi police on Thursday night arrested a 32-year-old man after a bullet fired while he was handing a rifle allegedly killed his mother.

The suspect has been identified as Vinod Baburao Sonkar, who allegedly also attempted to destroy the evidence by conducting the final rites of his mother before informing the police about the incident. Police nabbed him after they got information from sources about the incident, said police

Sonkar, 32-year-old resident of Talapwadi, was produced before a local court on Friday. He was remanded in police custody upto March 4. The deceased has been identified as Sakhubai Baburao Sonkar (60).

Sonkar has been booked under sections 304 (punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder), 201(Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender) and section 176 (Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it) of the Indian Penal code and sections 3, 5, 7 and 25 of Indian Arms Act, 1959 and section 135 of Bombay Police Act.

“On February 25, we got information from sources that villagers in Shahuwadi taluka had heard the noise of a bullet being fired and suspected the death of a woman. Following this, we raided a house and detained Dagadu Sakharam Chougule. We also recovered a rifle from his house,” said an officer attached with Shahuwadi police station.

During interrogation, Chougule told the police that the bullet was fired by Vinod unexpectedly while handling it. “We detained Vinod, who confessed of the act,” the officer said. The police said that Vinod told them that he and his mother had planned to visit a temple at Rajapur. On the night of February 25, they halted at Dagadu’s house, who was also planning to accompany them to Rajapur the next day.

Title: Five arrested for cheating 3 of Rs 1.5 lakh
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Vijayawada: Giddalur Police on Friday arrested five persons on the charge of cheating . The arrested are U Sekhar Reddy, G Venkatesh, K Venkata Sai Gopikrishna, U Krishna Kanth and G Krishna, all of whom belong to various parts of Krishna and Prakasam. Police recovered six mobile phones and 10 SIM cards from the gang.

Giddalur inspector Sudhakar Rao said three persons lodged police complaints regarding fraudulent transactions through Paytm to the tune of Rs 1.5 lakh.

Police said the five persons posed as employees of LIC and a few other banks and made calls to the people saying they had won a bonus for the LIC policy and that the cash prize would be credited to their accounts. Later, they asked for bank details, OTP and Paytm account details to create fake Paytm accounts using the SIM cards and transfered the money of the victims to their accounts.

Title: In Haridwar, search on for suitable land for burial of seers after state govt’s recent announcement to provide land where samadhis of seers can be made
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Haridwar: A long-pending demand of seers is likely to be fulfilled with the district administration initiating measures to earmark land for their burial spots (bhoosamadhi).

Deputy Kumbh mela officer Kushm Chauhan accompanied by Akhil Bharatiya Akhara Parishad general secretary Mahant Hari Giri and other members of akharas visited certain areas suggested by the seers such as Bairagi Camp, Gauri Shankar, Chandi Ghat and Neel Dhara areas of the Kumbh mela land as well as village Missarpur on Friday. A few weeks ago, the cabinet had decided to allocate land to akharas for making samadhi sthal of seers.

The seers had made the demand decades ago as immersion of their bodies in the Ganga (jalasamadhi) causes river pollution. They had therefore asked the administration to provide them land for burial so that the practice of jalasamadhi could be given up. Since the land requirement was quite large, the administration had so far not been able to meet the demand. However, the recent cabinet decision to provide land to seers for use as samadhi sthal has now raised the hope of an early fulfillment of their demand.

Giri told TOI, “If a sadhu dies during Kumbh, we will have to immerse his body in the Ganga, in the absence of land for burial. That is why, we want to expedite process of land being made available for samdahi sthal.” He added that commissioner of Prayagraj had allocated 5 acres for burial of sadhus if they happened to die during the Prayagraj Kumbh 2019.

Meanwhile, Chauhan said that the seers have been given some options of possible land. “These include land at Haddipur village, Devpura Ehatamal opposite Satikund and Gauri Shankar Dweep. Once they finalise their choice, the administration will decide on the area of land to be allotted to them.”

Title: Tamil Nadu: Wrecked by accident, bus turns home for 5
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

The five accident survivors cook, eat and bathe on the Omalur police station premises

OMALUR (SALEM): It looked like just another wrecked vehicle towed and dumped on a police station campus. The damaged minibus on the Omalur station premises, however, has five Nepal citizens living in it — cooking, eating and sleeping. It was on February 20 that a private bus rammed the vehicle near Omalur on the Salem-Bengaluru National Highway killing nine of the 32 passengers on board, all from Nepal.

Life hasn’t been easy for the two drivers and a tour agent who escaped unhurt in the accident as they wait for formalities to be completed so that they can return to their country along with the other survivors. On Thursday, two survivors who were discharged from the government hospital in Salem joined the trio in the bus.

Talking to TOI, 51-year-old tour agent Amarnath Chowdri said they had to be on the police station premises to complete the formalities. “The inquiry is going on. We have to submit documents such as vehicle registration certificate and insurance papers to police.”

Drivers Kaluram Chowdri, 38, and Anil Chowdri, 36, besides 65-year-old Baglu Chowdri and his wife Daithin Chowdri, 62, are with him.

They cook, eat and bathe on the police station premises. Police have allowed them to use washrooms at the station.

Deputy superintendent of police M Baskaran said, “We had arranged a marriage hall for them to stay, but they declined our offer. It seems they are wary of accepting any help from us. Language is also a barrier and it has affected the inquiry too.” Amarnath Chowdri, meanwhile, expressed hope that they would be able to leave for Nepal with fellow passengers in a couple of weeks. “It will take at least a week for us to reach our native place.”

While four people were killed on the spot in the accident, two others died in the hospital the same day. The toll rose to seven on February 21, when another critically injured person died in the Salem government hospital. Another injured person died in a private hospital in Chennai on February 23 and the ninth victim died in a private hospital in Coimbatore on February 25.

At present, five injured people are undergoing treatment in the Salem Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College and Hospital, one in a private hospital in Salem and 12 others in private hospitals in Coimbatore and Chennai. Their condition is said to be stable.

Title: Court orders stopping of inspector’s salary for ‘hampering’ gang rape case
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Bareilly: The fast track court of additional district magistrate Shrikrishna Chandra Singh has ordered Meerut SSP Ajay Sahni to stop the salary of Rohata station in-charge Upendra Singh Yadav till further orders for failing to depose before the court in an ongoing gang rape case in which he was the investigating officer.

According to sources, inspector Yadav was previously posted in Bareilly and was the investigating officer of a gang rape case dating back to 2017. Additional district government counsel Suresh Babu Sahu said that the officer failed to appear before the court to record his statement despite several reminders, thereby delaying the trial. At present, he is in-charge of Rohata police station in Meerut.

The ADGC said that, in its order to the Meerut SSP, the court stated that all witnesses had recorded their statements in the matter except investigative officer Yadav.

The court stated in its directive, “Despite several orders, he has intentionally been disregarding of court due to which judicial work is being hampered. In such a condition, it is necessary to stop his salary until he appears before the court and records his statement.”

Sahu said that the case pertains to the gang rape of a nurse of a private medical college while she was going to work on foot in 2017. He added that the three accused dragged her into the bushes and took turns to rape her.

The ADGC said, “When the three accused attacked her, she was talking over mobile phone with her husband. Hearing her screams over phone, her husband sensed that something was wrong and alerted police before rushing to the spot. On information, a police team also headed to the spot. Before they reached the crime scene, they found two persons near the said location and asked them if they had spotted a woman in distress. They denied having any knowledge of such a thing.”

Sahu said, “Police, however, clicked their photos on mobile phones. A further ahead, they found that a man was raping a woman. During interrogation, he revealed that his two accomplices had left the spot a few minutes ago and identified them when police showed him their pictures. They later arrested the other two accused too.”

Title: Replacing CCTV cameras in old Vadodara areas sparks rumours, tension
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Defunct cameras are being replaced by police, VMC

VADODARA: With Delhi riots spreading panic among the citizenry, even an innocuous routine activity like replacement of old CCTV cameras was looked upon with a suspicious eye in the city.

According to sources, fear was further triggered by the rumour mills spreading false messages on social media that the cameras were being ‘removed’ ahead of a “Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) support rally” in the city.

Looking at the misgivings, the police had to issue a clarification on Friday stating that the CCTV cameras were being repaired and replaced with new ones and not as being aired. In fact, there is no such rally proposed to be taken out in the city, they said.

The detection of crime branch (DCB) will also file a police complaint against unknown persons for spreading rumours and causing panic among the citizens. “Some days ago, the process of repairing old CCTV cameras and replacing defunct with new ones was initiated. It is a routine process. But some mischievous elements began spreading rumours to create unrest in the city,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime).

The messages states that many CAA, NRC supporters have planned a rally in the city in the lines of Delhi and incite the minority community members in old city to be “prepared for three days to face any kind of trouble” and to be on the alert on Saturday and Sunday. On Thursday night, a group of minority community members had also gathered in Yakutpura due to such rumours.

The police said that such messages are intended to spoil communal harmony in the city. “We have initiated the process to identify those spreading such rumours. We will also act against those who continue to make such posts viral,” Jadeja told TOI.

The police said that it is planning to install 1,400 CCTV cameras in the city and work on installing 400 high definition CCTV cameras in the walled city will begin within a few days. The walled city already has 257 cameras in Panigate, Wadi, City and Karelibaug.
