When police did arrive the next day, their house had already been burned down to ashes, Chand said, adding that the house next door, belonging to a Sikh family, was spared.

At Chandu Nagar, where hundreds of families from Khureji Khas have taken refuge, there is a strong sense of anger. “Anees bhai fought for the country on the borders, but they (the mob) didn’t think twice before burning down his home,” said Mohammad Saleem, a neighbour who has also moved out temporarily.

Title: Telangana HC sentences three forest officials to two-month jail
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Justice MS Ramachandra Rao of Telangana HC on Friday convicted divisional forest officer of Mancherial division D Ramalingam and two of his colleagues — Vijaya Kumar Sahal and Satish Kumar of Bellampalli range — in a contempt case and sentenced them to two months jail and imposed Rs 20,000 penalty.

The judge pronounced order after hearing the grievance of Mekala Mallesh and his wife Rajitha who charged the forest officials with obstructing them from entering their farmland contrary to protection orders from the court. The couple was allowed by the court to cultivate a piece of land in Akinepalli but officials were not allowing them to cultivate.

Title: 4 per cent reservation for Muslims may go: Mohammed Ali Shabbir
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Mohammed Ali Shabbir (Image courtesy - Facebook)

HYDERABAD: Former Congress minister Mohammed Ali Shabbir said the 4% reservation to Muslims in jobs and education being implemented in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh , could be taken away.

“The 4% reservation in jobs and education has so far empowered nearly 20 lakh poor Muslims under BC-E category in both Telugu states since 2004-05. The former Congress regime had implemented the Muslim quota in 58 days after coming to power in 2004. However, given the way the BJP government is functioning at the Centre and the manner in which the TRS government is pursuing its hidden agenda, fears over continuation of Muslim quota have increased,” he said.

He was speaking at a prize distribution function for students in Kamareddy on Friday.

Title: Delhi: SC directs fresh test of drinking water by CPCB
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

BIS said water quality of many cities was found to be below par with Delhi’s water being the worst among 21 bi... Read More

NEW DELHI: In view of contradictory reports of Bureau of Indian Standards and Delhi Jal Board on quality of drinking water in the capital, the Supreme Court on Friday directed the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to undertake fresh laboratory testing of piped water supplied to residences.

In its recent report, BIS said water quality of many cities was found to be below par with Delhi’s water being the worst among 21 big cities. The study was conducted on the directions of the ministry of consumer affairs, food & public distribution to check quality of piped drinking water being supplied in the country in keeping with the objectives of ‘Jal Jeevan Mission’. The Centre and Delhi government had traded allegations soon after the report was made public.

Standing by the BIS report, its counsel Vipin Nair told a bench of Justices Arun Mishra and Deepak Gupta that the testing of water samples were done by two reputed accredited laboratories in Delhi and Mumbai and their findings cannot be questioned.

But the BIS findings were dismissed by the Delhi government and Delhi Jal Board which contended that water samples from eight out of nine places picked up by BIS had been found to be fit for drinking during a second analysis. They also conducted a separate study by a committee which included specialists from National Environmental Engineering Research Institute which said the water quality was good.

Facing dilemma on whose report should be relied upon, the bench said water samples have to be retested again by another agency and entrusted the task to CPCB. It directed the Board to collect random samples of water from different locations and analyse them. It asked the Board to also involve officials from BIS and DJB in the task and file report before the court within 15 days. It said the contamination of drinking water may be because of leaking pipes and asked the authorities to suggest measures to deal with the problem.

Title: Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt can't stop gushing over this video of Taimur Ali Khan assisting Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan on the sets; comment, 'steal him', 'OMG!'
Content: After impressing the audience with his stellar performance in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' as Udaybhan Singh Rathore, Saif Ali Khan is all set to step into the shoes of another negative character. The talented actor will be going face-to-face with Prabhas in Om Raut's upcoming film 'Adipurush'.Saif, who started his career with 'Parampara' in 1993 has gone on to deliver several blockbusters on the silver screen. The versatile actor, who is known for taking up challenging and entertaining roles, has always managed to do justice to his characters. While the news of Saif stepping in as Lankesh in Adipurush' has got fans excited, we take a look at the dark and negative characters which the skilled actor has essayed on the silver screen.

Title: States cannot shy away from NPR: P Muralidhar Rao
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

P Muralidhar Rao

HYDERABAD: BJP national secretary P Muralidhar Rao on Friday said state governments will have a key role in finalising the roadmap for implementation of NPR.

Taking part in a debate on CAA here, he said: “NPR needs to be implemented by the state governments. They all know it, but are politicising it.”

He said GST became a reality with the help of state governments. “Similarly, NPR will be implemented.”

Stating that no decision on NRC had been taken, Rao said what Union home minister Amit Shah was saying is BJP’s line of thinking. “As party leaders, we support both NPR and NRC.”

Rao said that CAA was not against any citizen of this country. There was nothing in CAA that harmed the interests of Muslims.

He informed the audience that during Prime Minister Narendra Modi regime, more than 550 Muslims were given citizenship. Whereas about 13,000 Hindus and Sikhs were given citizenship when Manmohan Singh was prime minister.

Title: Pune telescope helps detect biggest blast in space since big bang
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Scientists detect the explosion, which happened many million light years ago and wasn’t in the visual range, b... Read More

PUNE: An international team of scientists has detected the biggest explosion in the universe since the big bang — a blast from a supermassive black hole at the centre of the Ophiuchus galaxy cluster, 390 million light years away.

The colossal explosion, five times bigger than anything observed before, was discovered using four telescopes, including the Giant Metrewave Radio Telescope ( GMRT ) in Pune. The other three were Nasa’s Chandra X-ray observatory, ESA’s XMM-Newton and the Murchison Widefield Array (MWA) in western Australia.

Radio data from the GMRT played an important role in unravelling the mystery about the nature of this explosion. The data was taken in 2008 and was available in the observatory archive. It was re-analysed by researchers to get an improved radio image, which nicely complemented the frequency coverage of the Australian MWA telescope while providing higher resolution for a more detailed look at the cluster, said Yashwant Gupta, director of the National Centre for Radio Astrophysics here.

Scientists detect the explosion, which happened many million light years ago and wasn’t in the visual range, by studying the cavity in the hot gases surrounding the black hole.

All black holes have super-heated gas surrounding it called the cluster plasma. In the plasma of this supermassive black hole in the centre of the Ophiuchus galaxy cluster is a massive cavity.

The cavity around the plasma of this black hole had been previously seen with X-ray telescopes, said Melanie Johnston-Hollitt from the Curtin University node of the International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research.

To create such a cavity, an explosion of a huge magnitude would be required and scientists dismissed the hypothesis that it could have been caused inside the black hole.

To know more about the size of the cavity, scientists wanted to analyse the radio waves emerging from the cavity walls, which are in a very low frequency. “This would help understand the size of the cavity and also the nature of gas surrounding it. The diffused radio wave emission and its analysis told the scientists that it was coming from a very aged fossil of one of the most powerful energy outbursts. It is a fairly known fact that only explosions can cause such cavities in the cosmic world and scientists in a way reverse engineered to understand the magnitude of the explosion that most probably caused the cavity,” said Gupta

The finding underscores the importance of studying the universe at different wavelengths, Johnston-Hollitt said.

“This is a great example of how archival data from the GMRT can be mined for interesting new finds and justifies the efforts and resources NCRA has put in to preserve every bit of interferometric data taken with the GMRT since its inception in 2002,” said Gupta.

(With inputs from the media release by Curtin University, Australia.)

Title: DU students march against Delhi violence, want guilty booked
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Security forces patrol in a riot affected area in Delhi (REUTERS photo)

NEW DELHI: Seated on her wheelchair, Kanika thought it was important to raise her voice against the way Delhi Police, the Centre and the state government allowed riot to take place in northeast Delhi . On Friday, this political science student at DU’s Miranda House along with hundred others held a march in North Campus demanding action against perpetrators.

Holding banners and placards with messages “stand for peace and communal harmony”, “stop killing Muslims” and “DU for Communal Harmony”, students from different colleges came together and demanded BJP functionary Kapil Mishra be arrested for his alleged involvement in inciting violence. “Our college already organised sit-ins against the riots. Now, we are collecting material for the victims,” said Kanika.

Teachers also joined in the march, which started from Arts Faculty and covered Ramjas College, Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC), Daulat Ram and finally reached the Swami Vivekananda statue at Arts Faculty. Students from Lady Shri Ram College for Women (LSR) also came all the way to lend their support.

“It is high time we came out and called out the wrong doings of the government. What took so long to act and let the violence continue,” said a student from LSR.

They said they were even willing to volunteer and assist in the rehabilitation work and have collected relief material for the victims. Ambedkar University has also contributed for the same. “We have heard the prices of vegetables are very high in the area, considering that everything has been destroyed. We all need to come together and help them with necessary items,” said a student.

Calling it a “state-sponsored attack on Muslims,” Jawaharlal Nehru University Students’ Union (JNUSU) also took out a march till the secretariat, but were stopped midway. It demanded Delhi government to take responsibility and activate services to rescue, provide medical facilities and shelter to the victims.

Title: Allow staffer to represent me: Srinivasan to HC
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Hyderabad: India Cements MD N Srinivasan on Friday approached Telangana high court urging it to allow his employee G Pramod Kumar to represent him at the enforcement directorate special court in Hyderabad, that is hearing the ED case against him and his company in the money laundering case pertaining to AP chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy.

Pramod Kumar was made an authorised representative of the company and was already an accused in the case. “Since the law permits a co-accused to represent other accused, the same facility can be accorded to me,” Srinivasan said in his plea. He stated that even in old age, he was appearing before the court for the last several years and the case did not move forward much. “The trial court failed to consider these issues and dismissed my plea,” he said, explaining the reasons for the plea before the high court.

Title: 26 people duped of Rs 9L by telecaller
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Nashik: An unidentified person has cheated as many as 26 people on the pretext of updating their know your customer (KYC) details and asking them to click on a link sent on their cellphones. A complaint in this regard has been lodged with the cybercrime police station.

Senior inspector Devraj Borse of the cybercrime police station said a resident of Mahatmanagar lodged a complaint stating that he was cheated by an unidentified person on the pretext of updating the KYC of a payment wallet.

Later, more people came forward with the same complaint. They were also similarly cheated on the pretext of doing the KYC. The complainants said that they were made to download certain mobile applications, which are remote access through which the suspects got access to their bank accounts.

The cybercrime police said they had received many complaints wherein the suspects asked the victims to either click on certain links sent to them or download certain apps on their cellphones. This allowed the suspects entire access of the victim’s cellphone.

The police said that they had repeatedly urged people through different programmes not to share personal details to unknown telecallers. At the same time, people should also never share the One Time Password they receive from a bank for any transaction.

Title: After Friday prayers, protests in Old City
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Residents protest against the Delhi police and Citizenship Amendment Act at Masjid-e-Azazia in Mehdipatnam on ... Read More

Charminar: Hundreds of people protested against Delhi police and the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) after Friday prayers.

Many youths and elderly people came out of mosques shouting slogans and holding placards in large numbers at different places in Old City. They took strong exception against the Delhi police’s role during violence and demanded PM Narendra Modi to roll back contentious laws immediately with an effective manner.

Similarly, many people protested outside other mosques, including, Saidabad, Yakutpura, Chandrayangutta, Mehdipatnam, Vijaynagar Colony and Mallepaly, demanding a halt on NPR process immediately. Expressing solidarity with Delhi violence victims, the protesters marched and urged the central government to take immediate action against the trouble makers in eastern Delhi.

Anti-CAA stickers were distributed among the people by TS AP JAC members at some places to paste them at doors and vehicles. The people, however, were also asked to keep the enumerators at bay by maintaining silence and no information should be shared with them.

“You have to paste these stickers at the doors and vehicles so as to let enumerators know that you are Indian and have nothing to do with controversial NPR,’’ one of the TS AP JAC members, Osman Mohammed Khan urged public while distributing stickers at Vijaynagar Colony.

Mushtaq Malik, convener, TS AP JAC told TOI that the movement would not paused till demands are met. He alleged that Chief Minister. K. Chandrashekar Rao was misleading people by making false assurance.

“The Government must make clear it’s stand if it’s really concerned with regard to public worries. Though there are reports or speculations are making rounds that NPR may get stayed but it is being clearly assured by this government. JAS insists this Government to make it’s stand clearly and sincerely,’’ urged, Mushtaq Malik told TOI.

Title: Coal handling cap relaxed for 2 cos at MPT
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Panaji: The Goa State Pollution Control Board ( GSPCB ) on Thursday relaxed the cap on coal handling by South West Port Ltd (SWPL) owned by Jindal Steel Works and Adani Mormugao Goa Port Terminal Pvt Ltd, at Mormugao Port Trust ( MPT ). The capping had been imposed following complaints of air pollution in Vasco .

The board’s chairman, Ganesh Shetgaonkar, told TOI that the relaxation was permitted upon the request of both companies. SWPL had sought reinstatement of the original consent to handle 5.5 million tonne of coal/coke annually, while Adani had sought to handle 5.2 million tonne per year.

Shetgaonkar said that under the current consent to operate, the monthly coal handling capacity for both companies had been cappped at 4 lakh tonne per month and 4.8 million tonne per year. The monthly capping, he said, had made it difficult for the companies to adjust shipments, due to which they had had to pay demurrage.

“Now, with the relaxation, if the coal handled during a particular month is less than the capping quantity, it can be adjusted in the following month’s shipment,” he said.

A decision on the relaxation of the cap had been deferred at GSPCB’s last meeting in December, 2019, when member secretary Shamila Monteiro said that IIT-Bombay had submitted a report on the source appropriation study at Vasco and that it was required to be analysed by the board’s scientific section. The report was expected to quantify the contribution of emissions from various sources that lead to air pollution in Vasco.

After deliberations, the board had decided that since IIT-Bombay had not submitted its final report, no amendment would be made to the consent to operate yet.

Title: Attapur revenge killing: Three get life for hacking electrician to death in 2018
Content:
One of the accused hacks Ramesh in full public view

HYDERABAD: A local court, on Friday, convicted all three accused of the murder of a 24-year-old electrician at Attapur in full public view on September 26, 2018. The trio was sentenced to life imprisonment and asked to pay a fine of Rs 2,000 each.The XIII Additional District Judge Court, LB Nagar, convicted V Kishan Goud, 48, electrician from Goshamahal, his brother-in-law, A Laxman Goud, 35, electrician from Dhoolpet, and their friend, Vikram Singh, 25, of Mangalhat, for the murder of J Ramesh from Jummerath Bazar.At 11.30 am on September 26, 2018, J Ramesh had gone to Upparpally court in Rajendranagar to appear before the magistrate in connection with a murder case booked against him for allegedly killing Kishan’s son, V Mahesh Goud, in 2017 in Shamshabad.Kishan, who wanted to take revenge for his son’s murder, decided to kill Ramesh, and sought help from Laxman.Kishan and Laxman came to know about Ramesh’s court appearance on September 26 and hatched a plan to kill him. They sent Vikram to the court to track Ramesh’s movements.As per plan, after Ramesh left the court, Vikram followed him for some distance and alerted the duo. At PVNR Expressway’s pillar number 145, the accused spotted Ramesh.He, too, saw them and tried to escape by boarding an auto. But Laxman managed to get into the auto as well. So, Ramesh had to escape from there.Ramesh then stopped Rajendranagar traffic constable, P Lingamurthy, who was passing by on his bike. “While I was on patrolling duty, one person, who suddenly got out of an auto, came to me saying that people were trying to kill him. He asked me to take him to safety. As he sat on my bike, a person wearing a yellow shirt pushed him off. We fell on the road.“The man in yellow shirt and his associate, who was in blue shirt, chased the man on the road and started attacking him with an axe. I caught hold of one of them to prevent him from assaulting the man, but the second accused took the axe and attacked the man, killing him on the spot,” said Lingamurthy in his statement. During the trial, 32 witnesses were examined.

Title: Act against illegal buildings around Goa airport: HC to Navy
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The high court of Bombay at Goa on Friday directed the Navy and director general of civil aviation (DGCA) to initiate action against unauthorised constructions around the Goa International Airport within nine months and submit a compliance report by March 31, 2021.

The high court passed the judgement in a writ petition challenging the construction of around seven highrises around the airport and airbase at Dabolim.

Among these highrises are buildings owned by panchayat minister Mauvin Godinho's close aide Kamla Prasad Yadav, who has "unauthorised constructions" in survey No. 60/2 of Chicalim by his firm Venture Building Dreams. Yadav is also a deputy sarpanch of Chicalim.

“In so far as the constructions, which have come up in the property bearing survey No 60/2 of Chicalim village, we direct the Flag Officer, Commanding, as well as authorities enjoined to make final orders under Rule 6 of 1994 Rules to initiate or complete action as expeditiously as possible and in any case within a period of six months from today,” said justices Mahesh Sonak and Mukulika Jawalkar in the judgement.

The court also took serious note of the resolution passed by Mormugao Planning and Development Authority (MPDA) on November 18 rejecting the Navy's colour-coded zoning map (CCZM).

Godinho, the Dabolim MLA, and Yadav are both members of the MPDA that rejected the colour-coded map and granted permission to builders to construct highrises within the path of an aircraft which is landing or taking off from the airport.

The court said aviation safety is paramount and thus provisions of the Aircraft Act, the 1994 Rules, the 2015 Rules and the CCZM prepared by the Navy take precedence over MPDA’s resolution.

The court has also issued directions to DGCA, South Goa collector, Chicalim panchayat and MPDA to ensure that unauthorised constructions are not allowed to come up in proximity of the Goa International Airport.

Godinho had accused the Navy of ruling Goa by proxy and regulating construction around the state’s lone airport. At the core of Godinho’s outrage are buildings with over 100 flats—survey numbers 60/2, 63/5 and 63/8— built by Yadav.

The Union civil aviation ministry’s rules, issued in 2015, restrict the height of buildings within a 20km radius of a runway.

The court has given some relief to builders who had complained that the Navy takes more than six months to grant clearance for construction.

“We direct the Flag Officer, Commanding to dispose of the applications seeking the NOCs for constructions as expeditiously as possible and in any case within a period of three months,” the court said.

Title: Maharashtra: Absconding man arrested after 40 years
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: Forty years after an offence was registered against a man under the Essential Commodities Act for selling adulterated petrol, the Swargate police arrested him from his village in Bhor taluka on Thursday.Now 65-year-old, the man is currently the sarpanch of Bhambawade village.Despite summons and warrants issued against him by the magistrate court, Vijay Garud did not report for hearing. The offence was registered against him in 1980. The Swargate police teamproduced him before the court on Thursday, following which he was released on bail.Garud, who worked at a petrol pump in Katraj Ghat section, was arrested along with two others in 1980 by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for selling adulterated petrol. “After his release on bail, Garud did not report for hearing in the court,” Brahmanand Naikwadi, senior inspector, Swargate police, told TOI.Recently the Bombay high court issued directives to courts to clear pending cases. The magistrate court informed the Swargate police about Garud.Following the court’s order, Naikwadi formed a team to trace Garud. “When the team went to Garud’s address in Bhor taluka, they failed to find him. During the probe, the team found a person by the name of Vijay Garud has been the sarpanch of Bhambawade village in Bhor taluka for the past 15 years,” Naikwadi said.

Title: 25,000 saplings to boost green cover in south Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

As many as 5,000 saplings were planted at the biodiversity park

NEW DELHI: The Hero-TOI Green Drive continues to boost the flora cover in the national capital. A large number of responsible citizens participated in the latest event held as part of the green campaign and did their bit for the environment.

Hero MotoCorp and the Times Group had jointly organised the mega plantation drive at south Delhi Biodiversity Park on Wednesday. As many as 5,000 saplings were planted at the biodiversity park, which is located behind Kalindi Colony and close to Kilokari village. In the next few days, over 25,000 saplings will be planted to complete the drive here.

It has been cited as a great initiative to restore the fast-depleting green cover of the region that has seen an increase in pollution levels and cases of respiratory diseases in residents.

Addressing the people gathered at the event, CR Babu, noted environmentalist and professor emeritus from CEMDE-Delhi University, said, “This area sees traffic round the clock. When you look around it, there is no green cover to assimilate the emissions. What we are doing today is something unique. This kind of plantation does not exist anywhere around this traffic-congested area.”

The park is spread over 167 hectares of land and 95% of it is covered by wetlands, which are extremely beneficial for CO2 consumption.

“We are working towards the conservation of these wetlands to ensure safety for millions of birds. Conserving these wetlands can also help in addressing the water scarcity in south Delhi and nearby areas since they replenish groundwater constantly,” Babu added.

“Today, professor Babu’s green vision has already come true with the start of the plantation. I am sure within a couple of years, this place will be very different, with vast greenery,” said Vijay Sethi, chief information officer, chief human resource officer and Corporate Social Responsibility head at Hero MotoCorp.

Dr Randeep Guleria, director, All India Institute of Medical Sciences, talked about how plantations at such a large scale can help reduce the carbon footprints of major events, conferences and routine life. “This will help reduce the carbon footprint and increase the green cover in the area.”

The drive, a major initiative by Hero MotoCorp and the Times Group, which began in Delhi, has managed to boost the greenery quotient of cities across the country over the past few years. After over 1 lakh saplings were planted across Delhi’s three biodiversity parks in 2015, the drive moved to Indore and Chandigarh where 2 lakh saplings were planted in 2017. In 2018, the drive covered Indore, Ahmedabad, Chennai and Delhi, and these cities went greener by 5 lakh trees. As many as 3.6 lakh saplings were planted as part of the drive during the financial year of 2019-20, while total 12.5 lakh saplings have been planted since 2015.

Title: Goa: Quepem lessors get property tax notice
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

QUEPEM: Residents who have rented out their houses or rooms have raised a banner of protest over the move of Quepem Municipal Council (QMC) to impose property tax on such properties from 2016 to 2020, alleging that the process has been initiated without proper verification and consultation.

QMC has sent hundreds of these notices to house owners under Section 110 of the Goa Municipalities Act, 1968.

“QMC has imposed the tax without verifying whether rooms or houses were given on rent from that period,” a property owner said.

In its notices, QMC stated that tax should be assessed based on rateable value — rent for which such as building on land reasonably be expected to let or for which it is actually let from year to year, whichever is greater.

The owners have to pay annually 8% of the rented amount. The annual value is arrived out after deducting 10% of annual value in lieu of all allowances for repairs. The notices follow QMC’s resolution on May 23, 2017, for imposition of property tax, but no notices had been issued.

Former chairperson Thereza Travasso is one of the recipients of two notices, with a directive to pay Rs 18,664 within a month’s time. “How can they send me such notices when I am not the house owner?” she said.

Around 50 Condi residents gathered in their ward on Thursday, demanding withdrawal of the notices.

“I am suffering from cancer. There is no earning member in my house. I am running my house on rent which is collected from my adjacent house. Now I received a notice to pay Rs 16,000. Why should I pay this tax when I am paying house tax of that house?” questioned Luis Rodrigues.

QMC chief officer Rohit Kadam said the notices have been sent as per the procedure. “If anyone has any grievances they should come and resolve them with the council,” he said.

Title: Delhi government sets up nine shelters for riot-affected
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

BSES staff work overtime to restore power lines in Shiv Vihar

NEW DELHI: Delhi government would start distributing Rs 25,000 in cash as immediate relief from Saturday to people whose houses were burned in the riots in northeast Delhi , chief minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Friday.

Addressing a press conference, the CM said: “The balance cheque will be provided to them after proper assessment is done by PWD. Any NGO, social organizations and individual donors who would like to contribute to our relief and rehabilitation activities can contact the office of DM North East,” he said.

The government has also set up nine shelters for the riot-affected people. On Friday, it started distributing food there. On the treatment of patients currently admitted in government hospitals, Kejriwal said, “We are being contacted by the people regarding their friends and relatives admitted for serious injuries in government hospitals, but not getting proper treatment due to huge crowds. Delhi government will assess the situation and, if needed, patients with serious conditions and injuries will be shifted to private hospitals for proper treatmen.”

Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia said a compensation form would be issued on behalf of Delhi government. A mobile application will also be developed where citizens can lodge details of the loss of property, loss of vehicles, damage to the business and details of injury and death. The government will ensure quick verification and assessment of the details to provide immediate ex gratia amount of Rs25,000, Sisodia said, adding that the full compensation amount would be provided after 2-3 days.

Kejriwal said the government had appointed 18 magistrates and four night magistrates to assist in the relief work. “Night magistrates can coordinate relief and rehabilitation activities in any emergent situation at any time, along with measures like fixing street lights to ensure the security of residents at night,” he said.

The government was getting support from NGOs and RWAs in providing relief to the riot-affected areas, the chief minister said. He requested people to provide the government with relevant information on anyone needing food or other amenities.

Title: Gujarat government model schools to have common entrance test
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The state government, which plans to integrate all the ‘model schools’ with the newly announced scheme for ‘ Schools of Excellence ’, has decided to hold a common entrance test for these 84 schools.

“The aim was to enrol most meritorious students at taluka levels in the model schools. But this could not be achieved fully due to various reasons. So, we have decided to hold an entrance test in April to fill vacant seats from Class VI to IX,” said a senior government official.

Currently, a model school can admit a maximum of 360 students, but they are often underutilized. The government however remains confident that more students will come forward once these schools are included in the Schools of Excellence scheme and the government has decided to raise the school limit to 480 students per school. A provision of adding another 20 students in case of requirement has also been made. The total allotted strength of these 84 schools is about 30,000 students, which has now been enhanced to 42,000.

The concept of model schools was introduced by the Gujarat government in 2014 to provide quality education in government schools at par with any private school.

In all, there are 84 model schools in the state starting from upper primary (sixth standard onwards) to secondary and higher secondary classes.

Of these 84 schools, nine have science stream for class 11 and class 12 students while the remaining have general stream education. On Friday, the government also decided to introduce science stream in all the remaining 75 model schools. This decision is likely to benefit 11,000 students in the coming academic year as they can enrol for science stream in these schools. A budgetary allocation of Rs 4 crore has also been made for setting up lab facilities in the 75 model schools.

“The government has also decided to recruit highly meritorious teachers on a contractual basis to improve the education quality,” the official added.

The state government, on Wednesday, announced the scheme of Schools of Excellence in the state budget for 2020-21 in which it aims to develop 500 state-run schools by March end next year. The 84 model schools will be integrated into the scheme, for which a provision of Rs 250 crore has been made in the budget.

Title: PCMC drive next week to recover prop tax arrears
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pimpri Chinchwad: The civic body will launch a drive to seize properties of tax defaulters from March 3 in an attempt to recover arrears amounting to Rs920 crore.

Smita Zagade, assistant commissioner and chief of the property tax department, said, “Owners of 19,142 properties have to clear Rs920.18 crore as tax arrears. As many as 15,603 tax defaulters have arrears in the range of Rs1-5 lakh, amounting to Rs320.94 crore, while 2,293 properties have arrears in the range of Rs5-10 lakh, collectively worth Rs160.01 crore.”

She said, “Similarly, 1,023 properties with arrears in the range of Rs10-25 lakh are responsible for a deficit of Rs150.38 crore. Thirty-four defaulters have arrears of over Rs1 crore each. All this sum up to Rs211.04 crore. There are 148 properties having arrears in the range of Rs25-50 lakh amounting to Rs49.57 crore. On the other hand, 30 properties have arrears in the range of Rs50-75 lakh. All this add up to Rs18.69 crore. Eleven properties have arrears in the range of Rs75-99 lakh, collectively worth Rs9.51 crore.”

Special squads comprising civic officials and employees from anti-encroachment and property tax departments will take action against unauthorized commercial properties. “The squads from water supply and property tax departments will take action against residential properties as we will be disconnecting water connections of these properties. Squads of property tax officials and employees will seal the authorized commercial properties to recover the arrears,” Zagde said.

“Unauthorized commercial property owners will be told to either clear the arrears or demolish their properties. We have received sanction from municipal commissioner for allowing some defaulters to clear arrears in instalments,” she said.

Title: Gold paste worth Rs 35L seized from 2 fliers
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Hyderabad: Two passengers who arrived from Dubai in an Emirates flight were taken into custody on Thursday and gold paste was recovered from inside their socks. The smuggled gold was worth Rs 35 lakh.

To fool the customs officials, the accused duo opted for a green channel, suggesting that they were not carrying any items which invite customs duty. During the screening, the officials found the two passengers carrying suspicious material in their footwear.

“Based on the passenger profiling techniques, we pulled them aside and subjected them to frisking. Gold paste wrapped in polythene sachets was concealed inside the socks. We seized the paste,” said a customs official.

After processing the gold paste, the sleuths recovered 826 gm of gold, the market value of which is Rs 35 lakh. Cases under the Customs Act were registered against the offenders. tnn

Title: All eyes on SC as Goa hopes for some relief on Mhadei
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Panaji: Faced with an uncertain future over sharing the Mhadei’s water after the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal’s final decision was notified on Thursday, Goa now waits the March 2 Supreme Court hearing to stop Karnataka in its tracks.

A day after the Centre notified the tribunal award, Karnataka has decided to expedite work on the Kalasa-Bhandura project.

With very few options available, Goa is gearing to put up a strong case in the Apex court on Monday to stall Karnataka from going ahead with the controversial project.

The state government on Friday asserted that Karnataka cannot go ahead with work on the Kalasa-Bhandura project.Reacting to the publication of the notification of the Mhadei tribunal order and reports that Karnataka is preparing to go ahead with its drinking water project works, chief minister Pramod Sawant said that “till preparation and approval of revised detailed project report (DPR) and till all permissions in law are obtained, Karnataka cannot divert or use water”.

He also said that mere publication of the award in the gazette does not prejudice the state of Goa.

“Government of Goa is fully committed to the cause of protection of Mhadei and will strongly defend the interest of the state before the Supreme court”, he said in a statement on Friday evening.

Advocate general Devidas Pangam said the interim order passed by Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal on April 17, 2014, that stated that Karnataka cannot start work till it prepares and revised DPR and gets it approved by the Centre or the Mhadei Water Management Authority, still stands.

Though Sawant told TOI on Thursday that the state would seek a stay from SC against the notification, Pangam said there was no need for it as the SC had clearly said that the tribunal’s award would depend on the outcome of the petitions that will come up for hearing in July.

He also said there is already an urgent hearing on March 2 where Goa has sought an interim stay from the SC to restrain Karnataka from carrying out construction or any other activity on the Mhadei.

Pangam said that Karnataka has to now get central government permission, forest and wildlife board permission. “Before they take all the permission our case will be decided in the apex court,” he said.

On February 25, the state government filed an application before the Supreme Court seeking an interim relief to restrain Karnataka from carrying out construction or any other activity on the Mhadei.

The chief minister’s office said after senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi pleaded before the bench presided by justice D Y Chandrachud for urgent hearing, the court posted the matter for March 2.

February 20, the Supreme Court, in an interim order, directed the Centre to notify the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal’s award of August 14, 2018, but said it was subject to the outcome of the petitions filed by the riparian states—Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra—against the award.

The Supreme Court also admitted Goa government’s special leave petition challenging the award and posted it for final hearing on July 15, 16 and 24.

MoEFCC minister Prakash Javadekar in a letter to Karnataka in December had said that Karnataka can start the work on Kalasa-Bhandura water drinking projects on Mhadei river after gazette notification of the tribunal and necessary forest and ildlife permissions.

Title: Pune: Traffic police make FC Road stretch two-way from today
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

The traffic police said the new arrangement on Fergusson College Road would be in place on an experimental bas... Read More

PUNE: The traffic police on Friday announced conversion of the Fergusson College Road stretch between Dnyaneshwar Paduka Chowk and Veer Chapekar Chowk (College of Agriculture) into a two-way facility.

Once the new system is in place from Saturday, motorists headed for FC Road from Ganeshkhind Road, Patil Estate, Wakdewadi and Model Colony will not have to take a detour from Sancheti Hospital and JM Road.

The traffic police notification, signed by additional commissioner Sanjay Shinde, cited the inconvenience caused to citizens for the new arrangement decision. It stated, “Vehicles coming from Narveer Tanaji Wadi, Patil Estate, Model Colony and University Road could not turn on to FC Road and had to take a detour from Sancheti Hospital and SG Barve Chowk. The notification was passed after a study by the officer in-charge of the Shivajinagar traffic division.”

Shinde said the FC Road stretch road would be made two-way for 15 days on an experimental basis. “Suggestions and objections have been invited from citizens. We will study the impact of the change. We will make the system permanent if there’s a visible impact,” he said.

The traffic police, through a notification in 2008, had converted the arterial Jangli Maharaj (JM) Road and FC Road into one-way stretches. Over two years ago, the police installed barricades on FC Road to develop a contraflow lane between Hotel Lalit Mahal and Dnyaneshwar Paduka Chowk to prevent a traffic choke-up in Model Colony.

Save Pune Traffic Movement director Harshad Abhyankar said, “Making both FC Road and JM Road one-way thoroughfares was a big decision in 2008. But there were no data to prove the impact of the arrangement. Have they now collected any data to prove that the situation will improve by making the FC Road stretch a two-way facility?

Parisar programme director Ranjit Gadgil said, “My concern is that the FC Road design was done keeping in mind the one-way traffic. There has to be a significant revision in the street design for the two-way system. The Pune Municipal Corporation may have to intervene to understand the objective of making the FC Road stretch a two-way facility and what it means for the design.”

Title: On a wing & a prayer: People run from pillar to post to trace missing relatives
Content:
Mansi Gupta’s relatives have circulated her picture social media platforms but there has been no positive resp... Read More

NEW DELHI: Five days after riots broke out in several parts of northeast Delhi , several families are still searching for their missing members. Most of them have already checked the hospitals, assuming they would find their near and dear ones either in the emergency block or at least in the mortuary, but to no avail.Delhi violence: Live updatesIn Mustafabad, the missing people include a college student from Ghaziabad who had come to appear for an exam but was yet to return home. Mansi Gupta ’s relatives have circulated her picture on WhatsApp and other social media platforms but there has been no positive response so far.Vipin Goyal, the uncle of the 20-year-old woman, said the situation was still tense and more so for them. “On Monday, my niece came to appear for an exam at Shyamlal college. She stays in Khoda but her sister resides in Shiv Vihar. On Monday, she wanted to visit her grandfather in Mustafabad but never reached his house. Initially, we thought she must have changed her plan but she can’t be traced since then,” said Goyal.Family members said that though police were approached soon, they could not do much. “We then tried to go to the Gokulpuri police station but couldn’t because of the curfew. Finally a case was registered in Ghaziabad,” Goyal said. Gupta’s relatives are also constantly trying to call her but her phone is coming switched off.Hamza Gyasuddin Ansari (25), a roadside vendor on 25 Foota Road in Mustafabad, has also been missing since Wednesday. Ansari Aarif, a relative, said, “My brother-in-law and I went for the evening prayer. Later on, we went to a friend’s shop and sat there. But I had to return home for some work. He said he would come later but never reached home. We went to the Gokulpuri police station but they did not hear us out. We dialled the emergency number found at Al Hind Hospital but there was no response. We checked other hospitals, too, but did not find him anywhere.”Another family member said they had submitted a written complaint to police. They have also prepared a poster with Ansari’s photo and details, and circulated it on the social media, but they are yet to hear from anybody.

Title: Beypore port’s import, export to get a boost
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Kozhikode: The Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) facility of the Indian Customs will start functioning at Beypore Port in a month. The full-fledged functioning of the EDI will help the movement of international vessels to Beypore Port and help the port to offer services to many exporters and importers from northern Kerala.

The EDI facility is coming up at Beypore Port as part of the initiative of the Union and the state government to promote coastal shipping through minor ports. At present, the exporters and importers from Kozhikode and other parts of north Kerala depend on Cochin Port for their business.

Installation of EDI is mandatory for getting customs clearance for the port. Only domestic vessels are permitted at Beypore and other minor ports in the state as the ports lack customs clearance.

“We have already received the EDI number and only the installation of the networks and other facilities are remaining at the EDI facility,” said Aswani Pratap, port officer. We are expecting more import business than export business; he said adding that the port was expecting to slowly attract the importers from northern Kerala.

Though Beypore Port received nod for starting export and import of goods to foreign countries over a year ago, the port has not been able to make use of the facility owing to various reasons. With the introduction of EDI at Beypore more business groups who import commercial goods from China and other countries are expected to depend on the port for cargo movement.

The introduction of the EDI facility will avoid the use of hard copies and manual customs clearance. The facility will also help to ensure the quick movement of containers. The EDI facility is coming up at the port at a cost of Rs 20 lakh.

According to the port officer, the government has announced special incentive for the promotion of coastal shipping. The vessels will first reach Cochin Port and then move towards Beypore, he said adding that port department was holding discussions with the clients to divert containers to minor ports.

At present, the importers are forced to pay for transporting the goods from the major port to different places in Malabar. Many such business persons are expected to depend on the Beypore Port once the port is permitted to accommodate vessels from foreign countries.

However, many other aspects including the size of the foreign vessels and the depth of the channel will play crucial role in the development of Beypore to a centre of international cargo movement.

Title: First night in jail: Reality bites Azam Khan and family
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Azam Khan gestures during a book release funtion at CM's official residence in Lucknow on wednesday

LUCKNOW: Mosquitoes tormented the Sultan of Rampur, Azam Khan , and his son Abdullah as shadows lengthened over the Sitapur prison ’s special cell, which bears a colonial stamp and an infamous label of housing notorious and hardened criminals like Unnao rape accused Kuldeep Singh Sengar and slain mafia don Munna Bajrangi. A jail official told TOI the cell was built by British in 1878 and only select prisoners were lodged here and the tradition has continued.

Azam, along with legislator wife Tanzeen Fatima and son were shifted to Sitapur jail on Thursday morning.

After meeting Azam on Friday morning, his daughter-in-law Sidra and elder son Adeeb lamented their family members were unwell and their first night behind bars was traumatic. “Mosquitoes bit them all through the night. Despite ill health, my elderly father-in-law and mother-in-law were moved from Rampur to Sitapur jail and nobody in the family was informed,” she told reporters.

She also claimed her mother-in-law Tanzeen was suffering from severe back ache from an old fracture. “Both parents are old and in pain. We have asked lawyers to take up the matter in court about the sudden transfer,” she added. Adeeb told newsmen he was eagerly waiting for his father, mother and brother to be released soon.

Just not Sidra and Adeeb, Azam had more visitors on Friday. At least 50 people, including SP members came calling. A jail official said the father and son skipped dinner on Thursday, but had tea and cracked wheat (dalia) for breakfast on Friday. “A video wall has come up at prison headquarters in Lucknow and a close watch is kept on activities of prisoners and visitors,” said a senior jail officer.

Title: Ex-probe officer, successor spar in court over Asthana case
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Former CBI special director Rakesh Asthana (PTI file photo)

NEW DELHI: A war of words broke out in a special CBI court on Friday between two investigating officers (IO) in the bribery case in which former CBI director Rakesh Asthana was given a clean chit recently. While former IO A K Bassi, appearing after a direction, accused current IO Satish Dagar of shielding “big names” despite clinching evidence, Dagar retorted saying Bassi was acting on a “presumption” and never showed up when asked to assist in the probe on multiple occasions.

Appearing before special CBI judge Sanjeev Aggarwal, Dagar accused Bassi of making “personal allegations”. The judge, after hearing both men, intervened and remarked, “Don’t wash your dirty linen in public.” He also said that both officials would be called in future, if required, but not together.

CBI had recently filed a chargesheet concluding that there was no connection between Asthana and the alleged middleman Manoj Prasad, and no evidence to prove that the former CBI director ever demanded or received a bribe to save Hyderabad-based businessman Satish Babu Sana in a money laundering case related to meat exporter Moin Qureshi .

During the proceedings, however, the court inquired about the status of investigation in the Moin Qureshi case. “Two guardian angels of CBI are involved in the case... How much time will you take to investigate the Moin Qureshi case where the two guardian angels, the two bosses, are involved? That case is Bhagirathi (sic),” the court remarked.

Earlier, Bassi claimed that on the day he handed over the charge of the bribery case, he was accused of filing a false FIR against Asthana. “The clinching evidence present in phone of Rakesh Asthana was never seized. From day one, he (Dagar) is working to give clean chit to Rakesh Asthana… There are WhatsApp messages.”

The former IO also claimed that nothing was asked about the messages lying in Prasad’s mobile phone. “When Sunil Mittal (Prasad’s father-in-law) was examined, he was under the influence of alcohol as per the CFSL report,” he added.

Mittal and Prasad’s brother Someshwar Srivastava are also involved in the case.

Following Bassi’s statements, Dagar responded: “And how does he know about all this? We would definitely like to know. How is he infiltrating the investigation?”

When Bassi said the details were in the newspapers, Dagar countered by saying “it never came out in newspapers”.

The current IO further accused Bassi of having “made personal allegations on his integrity”. He said, “I have better antecedents than him in the organisation.”

According to Bassi, during interrogation, Prasad admitted that he was in touch with special secretary R&AW Samant Kumar Goel and disclosed numbers of Srivastava in London, Singapore and Dubai. “He refused to divulge anything how CBI officials received money,” Bassi said.

Asthana and DSP Devender Kumar, who was arrested in 2018 in relation to the bribery case and later got bail, were given a clean chit owing to lack of evidence to make them accused.

Bassi said that following Kumar's arrest on October 22, 2018, he made a proposal for carrying out searches at Asthana's residence and office premises. “But that file never came back to me,” he said.

On October 23, 2018, he said, the Delhi high court was informed that CBI required Asthana’s mobile telephone and all electronic record lying in his possession and that he be directed to preserve the record. “There is an order that he should preserve the record,” said Bassi.

The former IO also said that at the time of handing over the case, he told Dagar that Asthana’s mobile has to be seized because there is clinching evidence. “There is an eight-page secret note of intercepted calls handed over to the current IO. It clearly says money was exchanged. Clearly mentions Rakesh Asthana,” Bassi claimed.

Dagar responded, “We’ve intercepted 11,381 calls, it is before the court. We haven’t shut the case. He (Bassi) hasn’t brought any evidence. He is acting under a presumption.”

Title: Education dept forms think tank
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pune: The state school education department formed a 32-member thinktank committee on Thursday to analyse, discuss and recommend decisions on issues like fees hike, among others.

Pune zilla parishad CEO Ayush Prasad, chairman of MSBSHSE Shakuntala Kale, former director of education Vasant Kalpande, retired joint director of education Bhau Gawande, Pune regional deputy director of education Anuradha Oak, SM Foundation’s Shantilal Mutha and Quest NGO member Nilesh Nimakar, among others, are part of the thinktank committee. The members will meet for the first time in Mumbai on Saturday. tnn

Title: Lucknow: SGPGI to get 60 ventilators, 400 more beds
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Taking into consideration the shortage of ventilators and beds in SGPGI Lucknow , the state government has decided to provide 60 new ventilators and 400 additional beds to the medical institute. This was announced by medical education minister Suresh Khanna at a conference in the institute’s nephrology department on Friday. “The ventilators and beds would be added in a phased manner over the next one year,” Khanna said.

Of these, 200 beds would be installed in the upcoming emergency unit while 30 would be added to the existing emergency unit with immediate effect. About 60 beds would be provided at the trauma centre while the remaining would be added to different departments. Khanna asked the doctors to work towards prevention and patient education. “Statistics show there is acute shortage of renal specialists in the country. This calls for immediate steps for prevention and patient education to save lives and manage the ailment,” the minister said.

Faculty, nephrology department, Prof Narayan Prasad said doctors from six states would deliberate on emerging challenges in renal care at the meet.

Title: Delhi riots: People wait at hospitals, hoping for the best, expecting the worst
Content:
Autorickshaw driver Babbu (35) was thrashed with iron rods. He was found in a pool of blood and his vehicle in... Read More

The body of 30-year-old Monis was identifi ed by his brother at GTB Hospital

Dilshad’s wife is yet to locate him

NEW DELHI: Days after the violence in northeast Delhi ebbed, many families are still searching for relatives who went missing during the riotous days. Some have located their bodies in hospitals, which have reported 42 deaths till Friday. Others are still ding the rounds.Delhi violence: Live updatesAutorickshaw driver Babbu, 35, left home in Bhajanpura’s Sri Ram Colony on Tuesday afternoon, but was thrashed with iron rods by a mob a short distance away. “Before leaving, he told us that he would take his auto elsewhere and not ply in the locality to avoid the violence,” his uncle Shami Ahmed said. “We tried to stop him, but he argued that if he didn’t go he could not earn money which was necessary because the situation was uncertain.”Two hours after going out, a family acquaintance informed them that Babbu had been found in a pool of blood, his vehicle in flames, and he had been taken first to Jag Pravesh Hospital and then to GTB hospital. He was dead when they reached the hospital. Babbu is survived by a mentally impaired wife and three children.Ahmed, like most of the people TOI spoke to at the mortuary in the past four days, hesitated to reveal the full names of the deceased and the family members. On Friday, many such people anxiously waited outside GTB Hospital to take back the bodies of their loved ones. The body of 30-year-old Monis was identified in the morning by his brother. He claimed that he had made at least 10 rounds to the mortuary in the last three days to find his brother but was not allowed to see the unidentified bodies. Today, after finally being permitted entry, he found his brother’s body.“When we came to the mortuary, we were told no one of that description was there. We were asked to check at AIIMS, Lok Nayak and Safdarjung hospitals. We visited these places, but didn’t find Monis’ body,” said the brother. “We did not go to the police station to lodge a missing person complaint because our neighbours warned us that the cops would only lock us up if we approached them and other things of that sort.”A distressed woman was yet to locate her missing husband. “Dilshad is nowhere to be found,” a frantic Farha said. “He left home on Tuesday morning and there’s been no contact with him since. We have five children. I am at my wit’s end.”

Title: 7 fraudsters held, Rs 7L recovered in land racket
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Hyderabad: Seven fraudsters, who duped people by showing forged property sale deeds in Toopranpet in Choutuppal mandal, were arrested. Apart from Rs 7 lakh, two cars and forged sale deeds of seven plots were recovered. Niranjan Goud, a TRS leader of Toopranpet, lodged a complaint alleging that the accused were duping people using forged documents. TNN

Title: Maharashtra: Women staffers at govt schools not to work beyond official hours
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Women staffers at government schools will no longer be forced to work beyond their official hours and on holidays in the state.

The state education department issued an order in this regard on February 24. The order is applicable to all schools affiliated to the state government, including those aided, unaided and semi-aided, Besides, it also applies to teachers’ training institutes as they have more than 50% women members.

The order follows women staffers’ complaints of being made to work beyond official duty hours and on holidays.

Director of education (primary) Dattatray Jagtap said Nago Ganar, a member of the Maharashtra Legislative Council from Nagpur Teachers’ Constituency, had written to the education department highlighting the complaints of women staffers, including non-teaching employees, at schools.

Ganar said in the education department, in schools and colleges, women constituted more than 50% of total staff. “The complaints also stated that the women non-teaching staffers were not treated respectfully by other employees,” he said.

Regional director of education (Pune), Anuradha Oak, has also issued notified all schools in the region to follow suit. A school teacher in a ZP school, Shilpa Gore, said, “Such a decision was the need of the hour. The work at school is unending and the limits should be set for the teachers and also non-teaching staff. In remote areas, many women teacher travel long distances and this decision will help them especially".

Title: Over 30 pleas to be heard on March 13
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pune: A special MPID court on Friday listed over 30 pleas opposing the attachment of 463 moveable and immovable properties belonging to jailed developer DS Kulkarni, alias DSK, and his relatives for hearing on March 13.

Special public prosecutor Pravain Chavan filed his say before the special judge, Jayant Raje, opposing around 22 pleas for confirming attachment of the properties.

Chavan also filed his say opposing the bail pleas of Makrand Kulkarni, younger brother of DSK, and Kedar Vanjape, who held the position of an executive director and head of legal and planning in the DSK group.

After the court proceedings, Chavan told TOI, “We have opposed around 22 pleas on the grounds that some investors have demanded distribution of money on a pro-rata basis. The flat owners have no right to stake claim on the entire housing projects as their rights are restricted to their individual flats and not otherwise.”

A lawyer submitted that the special court had no jurisdiction over the properties attached as the properties belonging to DSKDL and DSK Motors were subject matter of the NCLT proceedings.

Title: Delhi: S N Shrivastava takes over from Amulya Patnaik
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

S N Shrivastava, 1985-batch IPS officer, was appointed special CP (law and order) on Tuesday

NEW DELHI: IPS officer S N Shrivastava was given the additional charge of the next Delhi Police commissioner on Friday. The 1985-batch officer will be heading the 90,000 strong force from March 1 as the extended tenure of present police chief Amulya Patnaik ends on Saturday.

An order issued by the ministry of home affairs said that Shrivastava will hold the charge till further orders. Sources said a regular order of his appointment will also be issued within a week after necessary approvals are sought and obtained. Shrivastava is set to retire from the service next year.

Shrivastava was serving in CRPF in the profile of special director general (DG) since 2015. After Delhi Police came under fire for being unable to quell the northeast Delhi riots, Shrivastava was hand-picked by the home minister and the national security advisor to control the situation. In quick developments that unfolded on Tuesday evening, Shrivastava was repatriated to his parent cadre (i.e. AGMUT) and then placed as the chief of law and order, a move which took everyone by surprise.

Shrivastava took charge immediately. Led by Doval, Shrivastava remained on the ground for over 20 hours.

Known for his integrity and no-nonsense attitude, Shrivastava was the anti-terror chief in Delhi Police till 2015. Officers who have worked under him said he was a hard taskmaster with an eye for details. He had headed several departments in Delhi Police before proceeding on deputation to CRPF.

It was during his tenure that the Special Cell had wiped out the Indian Mujahideen and Lashkar-e-Toiba network from the capital. Brought in to the Special Cell in the aftermath of the High Court Blasts in 2011, he played a crucial role in strengthening it. While preventing any terror attack in the capital for over three years, the Cell went on to arrest 37 terrorists, including 22 from IM and 7 from LeT, since he took charge.

“IM’s deputy chief Tehsin Akhtar, Pak bomb-maker Waqas, Abdul Qarim Tunda and IM’s shadow techie Ajaj Shaikh are among the terrorists who are now behind bars due to his team’s efforts. His team also solved the 2012 Pune serial blasts and the Jama Masjid blast cases,” said a senior police officer.

Title: Minor detained for sexual assault
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pune: A boy (15) was detained on Thursday for allegedly sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl of his neighbourhood.

The boy was detained under Section 376 (rape) of the Indian Penal Code and the relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The Yerawada police also registered an offence against the boy’s mother for beating up and abusing the girl after the latter’s grandmother informed her about the incident.

An officer from the Yerawada police said the incident occurred on Wednesday evening. The complainant said her granddaughter went missing while playing outside the house around 5.30pm.

“When the complainant went on the terrace of her single-storey house after searching for her granddaughter at other places, she was shocked to see the boy harassing the eight-year-old girl,” the officer said.

The woman rescued her granddaughter, went to the boy’s house and complained to his mother. The boy’s mother, instead of taking her son to task, started abusing and beating up the girl.

“The girl’s grandmother then came to the police station and lodged a complaint. We have detained the boy and booked his mother for abusing and beating up the girl,” the officer said.

Title: Coronavirus threat: Saudi Arabia visas nixed, Umrah pilgrims return from Dubai
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: After Saudi Arabia suspended visas to pilgrims headed for Umrah in Mecca due to threat of coronavirus , more than 50 people from Lucknow were sent back from Dubai airport on Friday.Besides, scores of others on way to Saudi Arabia were stopped at Lucknow airport on Thursday itself. Many who had planned visits to Islam’s holiest site in the coming days were disheartened due to the sudden restriction.Intsar Mehdi, owner of a city-based travel company which sends batches for Haj and Umrah, is returning from Dubai along with fellow passengers after they were stopped on Thursday evening from proceeding to Mecca.“We left Lucknow for Dubai on Wednesday evening and were supposed to leave for Mecca on Thursday evening when our flight got cancelled due to suspension of tourist visa. We have around 55 pilgrims here from Lucknow and a few from adjoining areas. We were stuck for a few hours at Dubai airport and had to make arrangements to return. Now, we are flying back to Lucknow,” Intsar told TOI over the phone.While Haj, one of the five pillars of Islam, is performed annually, Umrah can be performed throughout the year. Roshan Begum, who was supposed to fly out on March 1, said she had arranged the money for travel after saving for three years. “This would have been my first Umrah. We have asked the operator for a refund,” said the 50-year-old.According to city tour operators, around 3,000 bookings were made in advance by Lucknow residents.Each person had paid around Rs 70,000 to tour operators, which included the visa, transport and accommodation. After the sudden suspension, travel companies said they will incur huge losses.“We had around 54 pilgrims ready to fly out on Friday. Now, airline tickets and hotel bookings have been cancelled. Umrah visas are given for a month. Those who wish to go will have to take new packages,” said Zafar Askari, a tour operator in Chowk.

Title: Shopowner foils attempt to snatch his cellphone
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pune: A shopowner in Kasba Peth foiled an attempt by a bike-borne duo to rob his cellphone late on Wednesday night and caught one of them in the process.

Police said shopowner Aniket Dhas (38) caught hold of Arshad Salim Shaikh (20) and dragged him down the vehicle when he tried to snatch his cellphone from his trouser pocket.

Seeing him falling off the vehicle, Shaikh’s accomplice drove away.

Dhas later lodged an FIR with the Faraskhana police. Shaikh has several cases of thefts registered against him, police said.

Tejasvi Patil, sub-inspector, Faraskhana police, told TOI that complainant Dhas runs a footwear shop near Kasba Peth fire station. Around 9.45pm on Wednesday, he was waiting in front of his shop to cross the road when Shaikh and his accomplice, riding a two-wheeler, stopped near Dhas.

“Shaikh who was riding pillion, checked whether Dhas was wearing any gold chain. He then tried to snatch his cellphone from the pocket of his trouser. But Dhas caught Shaikh’s hand and dragged him down the vehicle,” Patil said.

On seeing Shaikh falling off the motorcycle, his accomplice drove away.

“With the help of locals, Dhas nabbed Shaikh and handed him over to the police,” Patil said. She said Shaikh has several cases of thefts registered against him.

“We have launched a search for his accomplice,” she said.

“Our further investigation is on,” she said.

The crime branch of the Pune police recently recovered nine stolen cellphones worth Rs 1.60 lakh following the arrest of two men from Kharadi.

They used to snatch cellphone from women carrying the devices in their hands..

Title: JNUSU offers shelter to riot victims, gets administration’s notice
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pramod Kumar (Image taken from https://www.jnu.ac.in/ )

NEW DELHI: The Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) administration has served a notice to JNU Students’ Union (JNUSU) for asking the needy riot victims to take shelter in the campus. The varsity has asked the union to refrain from such activities.

In the notice, registrar Pramod Kumar, said: “JNUSU has no legal right to make the JNU campus a ‘shelter’. You are strictly advised against any such activity failing which appropriate disciplinary action will be taken against you.” Kumar claimed that some residents in the campus were feeling insecure with the JNUSU’s call.

The students union, however, claimed that the JNUSU office comes under their purview and that “JNU has always been open for people in need. We had also provided shelter to the 1984 riot victims.”

As part of their drive to “uphold social harmony,” the JNUSU had given a call for volunteers. It had stated while there are many rescue teams working in the city, “we would like to inform that our campus/JNUSU office is open to all people who need shelter.” Their posters had the names and numbers of four JNUSU central panel members.

Saket Moon, the JNUSU vice-president, who has also been served the notice, said that the administration should reconsider the notice.

“JNU has always been open for people in need of help. The campus had even opened its doors for the victims of 1984 riots, ” he said.

Title: Clashes in Delhi: From house of joy to sound of silence
Content:
Imrana held the 15-day-old Inaya and named so by her husband Mudassar

NEW DELHI: The house of Mudassar Khan in Mustafabad rang with joy a fortnight ago with the birth of a daughter. There are only tears in the house today. The 35-year-old was shot dead during the riots and his body discovered at Guru Teg Bahadur Hospital on Thursday. Imrana held the 15-day-old Inaya, named so by her husband Mudassar, and wept continuously on Friday. She has seven other daughters, not all of them of an age to understand the tragedy that has struck the family.Kesar Jahan, Mudassar’s mother, sorrowfully said, “Look at the faces of these children. The younger ones don’t even know what has happened. Who will secure their future now?” The eldest daughter, just 14 years old, mumbled, “It was my birthday on February 14, and papa gifted me a gown.”Yusuf Khan, younger brother of the deceased plastics manufacturing businessman, described Mudassar as a ‘problem solver’. “My brother had gone to Kardampuri for some work on Monday. He got stuck there and told me about the outbreak of violence. I asked him to stay indoors until the situation improved. The following day he called in the morning. He was worried at the escalating situation and asked me to come and accompany him back home.”Yusuf reached the Brijpuri bridge, where he found rioters from both communities furiously throwing stones at each other. “I called my brother repeatedly but he did not answer his phone. I was really afraid. Then the phone was answered by a stranger who said my brother had been lying dead on the road and a man driving a Tata 407 had left his body at GTB Hospital.”The family took the help of a local politician and the station house officer to reach the hospital and claim his body. Teary-eyed and lost, Mudassar’s father muttered, “He had a gunshot wound on his head. He was a responsible son.”Even though a large contingent of security officials was deployed in the area on Friday, the residents did not feel secure. “The situation is tense and we venture out of our houses only for a couple of hours,” said Yusuf. “People of both communities live in the locality and we had never faced this horrible situation. In fact, the locals say it was unfamiliar outsiders who created havoc.”

Title: Legal trial will help us prove innocence: Umar Khalid
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Umar Khalid

NEW DELHI: After Delhi government gave permission for the prosecution of former JNU Students’ Union (JNUSU) president Kanhaiya Kumar and nine others, including student leader Umar Khalid , many of them welcomed the decision. They claimed that it would allow them to prove their innocence in court and that they would be free from “media trial.”

Umar Khalid, one of the principal accused in the chargesheet that was filed last year, said: “I am glad this case will reach a court. I am convinced of my innocence and I will stand vindicated by the end of the trial.”

He added that they have been demanding for the past four years that the trial should begin. “It took the government four years just to begin the trial. It shows how weak the case is. I will cooperate with the trial as I have full faith in the judiciary. A legal trial will prove our innocence, and it will show how baseless, false and malicious the media trial was.”

He also released a joint statement with Anirban Bhattacharya on Twitter. “...And as we will defend ourselves in the court, we will expose the lies of the ruling regime and its fake claims of being nationalist,” he tweeted.

Kanhaiya Kumar was not available for a response.

N Sai Balaji, AISA national president and former JNUSU president , said: “We have been saying it from the first day that the matter should go to a court because the whole case was part of the media propaganda. Now, it will be exposed that police have no evidence against the accused.”

However others, who were named in the chargesheet, but not as principal accused, questioned the timing of the government decision. “The delay showed that the central government was using the case to divert attention. But it is now clear that Delhi government also wants to use this case to divert the whole narrative about its inadequacy during Delhi riots,” said Ashutosh, former JNUSU president.

Rama Naga, who was then the general secretary of JNUSU, said that “seeing the overall situation in Delhi right now it is clear that a pressure has been built, which is reflected in the action of Delhi government.” “There should be a speedy trial and people should know the final verdict. We have said time and again that we will cooperate with all forms of inquiry,” added Naga, a PhD student at Centre for political studies.

Title: Pune: Guard held on molestation charge
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A security guard (30) of a housing society was arrested on Thursday on the charge of outraging the modesty of a 11-year-old minor girl .

The guard was arrested under Section 354 (assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty) of the Indian Penal Code and the relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

An officer with the Vishrantwadi police said the incident occurred on the premises of the housing complex on Thursday afternoon. “The security guard lived with his family in a room in the parking area. During the afternoon, the minor girl visited his room to play with his three-year-old daughter,” the officer said.

The officer said according to the complaint lodged by the minor’s mother on Thursday afternoon, the guard asked the 11-year-old girl to enter his house. “The complaint stated that he touched the minor inappropriately and attempted to disrobe her. He also used lewd language. The terrified girl managed to escape from the room and told her mother about the incident,” the officer said.

The police arrested the guard following the mother’s complaint. “Our probe is on,” the officer added.

Title: CCTVs snapped: UP Boards hit by copying
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: The claims of the state government to conduct cheating-free UP Board exams are falling flat.

In Barabanki, two superintendents were removed on Thursday for negligence. At Jagriti Inter College, Suratganj, centre superintendent Ramesh Chandra Ojha and external superintendent Sarita Bharti were relieved of their duties after examinees were seen seated in two rooms that neither had a camera nor a router.

“Despite strict instructions to conduct exams under CCTV vigil, students at this centre took the paper without camera surveillance. A report has been sought,” said Rajesh Kumar Verma, district inspector of schools, Barabanki. Notices have been issued to 13 more colleges for undermining the sanctity of board exams. At Sundar Lal Inter College in Safdarganj, Barabanki, an official on surprise inspection found girls taking exams in rooms where DVRs were disconnected.

Title: Citizens’ groups meet MP Jayant Sinha
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Pune: Citizens’ groups working in the realty sector met MP Jayant Sinha, the chairman of the standing committee on finance, on Monday to discuss their objections to the amendment to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016, which requires a “minimum threshold” of homebuyers for approaching the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT).

In December, the government had passed an ordinance to amend the code, mandating a threshold of a minimum of 100 or 10% of total homebuyers in a project, whichever is less, to take the builder to an insolvency court.

The groups, under the Forum for People’s Collective Efforts (FPCE) led by Abhay Upadhyay, had objected to the threshold on social media, following which Sinha invited them for a hearing. The meeting was attended by FPCE’s Abhay Upadhyay, Tarun Jindal and OP Bangur.

In a separate and revised letter to the standing committee on finance on Saturday, FPCE had said the right of a homebuyer to approach a court of law for help cannot be termed as potential abuse. Also, it cannot be construed that only facts can be considered as genuine when either 10% or 100 people say it together.

“If we start this practice of considering genuineness and authenticity of allegations based on number of complainants, it will have unmanageable adverse ramifications. There will never be any convictions as gathering numbers will be an impossible task,’’ the groups stated in the letter.

The members of the groups have reiterated the request for removal of the condition of “minimum threshold” to initiate insolvency proceedings. “Developers are using this as an escape route as no such categorization is done at the time of booking and seeking refund on account of unreasonable delay in possession cannot be a crime for any category of customers,” they said.

Title: Delhi riots: Plea in SC raises concerns over fairness of probe
Content:
This story is from February 29, 2020

Prashant Bhushan
